loans.use: to buy wax cotton, lace, shirts, and slippers

loans.name: Juan María

texts.en:
Juan Maria is a responsible, hardworking person who has previously taken loans from Edpyme Alternativa with Kiva's support. Indeed, he has punctually owned up to his previous commitments with these institutions. 

Given that he lives in a rural area with no access to basic services and which can be hard to reach for many other credit providers, the work that Edpyme and Kiva carry out in allowing access to capital for entrepreneurs like Juan Maria is crucial. 

He is 36 years old, with four children and living in Northern Peru. Outside his house he has land that he has used to grow lemons and mangos, with the lemon crop being commericalized on a  weekly basis. Moreover, he has a small area where he raises poultry to provide additional income for his children. He has dedicated more than 12 years of his life to these activities and has developed strong expertize in this field. Hence, he is now looking to take a loan in order to buy fertilizers and other organic products to protect his lemon crop during its consolidation period.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other organic products to protect his lemon crop during its consolidation period.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
This is Delia, 52, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Faustino and is the mother of two children who are both already working. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Delia operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families eat home-cooked meals only during evenings, when all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. 

Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 13,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Delia hopes to be able to expand the business soon. She also hopes to have her house renovated by the end of the year. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. Juditha has been in this business for 10 years and she earns additional income from food vending.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her furniture-making business.

Juditha has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Elena Aurora

texts.en:
Elena is a 50 year old woman, living in her own house where she has established a cafe. She lives in Northern Peru in a rural area near Tambogrande. She has developed a strong reputation as a reliable supplier of quality food that locals enjoy. She has been involved in this activity for the last six years.

Indeed, she has worked very hard to consolidate her small business and has previously taken out a loan with Edpyme Alternativa supported by Kiva, having used it to buy supplies for her shop. 

As the number of clients have increased and the range of food offered becomes wider, she now looks to make a second loan of 2000 PEN to buy a fridge. 

Rural areas are often harder to reach and as a result the incentive to provide them with access to credit is smaller for bigger capital providers. Hence, the role of Kiva and Edpyme for this type of client is particularly important.

loans.use: To buy a fridge to store some of her products.

loans.name: Jaznalyn

texts.en:
This is Jaznalyn, 31, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. She has one child and manages her household while operating her business. Jaznalyn works hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses. She operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, where groceries, toiletries, and beverages are sold piecemeal in the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy a sachet of shampoo, 5-PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Jaznalyn earns money by getting her supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Jaznalyn's store is located adjacent to her house and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Jaznalyn earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

Jaznalyn is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands. Jaznalyn hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
This is Rosalina, 49, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Gerardo and is mother to their two children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Rosalina operates a stainless steel shop. She handles finances, accounts, inventories and promotion. They offer made-to-order stainless steel doors and window frames and also repair of any type of stainless steel doors or windows that are referred to them. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy supplies like glass, stainless steel materials, silicon and other materials used in the business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rosalina hopes to expand her business soon. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Luisita

texts.en:
Luisita is married with five children. She works hard to support her family and runs a banana business in the Philippines. Luisita also earns additional income from a sari-sari (variety) store. She has been sustaining her business through her three past loans from NWTF.

Luisita is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of bananas to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bananas to sell

loans.name: Belgiqque Group

texts.fr:
Mme MINATA est la responsable du groupe BELGIQUE. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. Le plus âgé a 37ans et le moins âgé a 18ans.02 de ses enfants vont à l’école et elle a 02 personnes à sa charge.

Mme vend des produits pharmacopées et des tisanes depuis 17ans. Elle s’approvisionne au Ghana. Ses clients sont les hommes, les femmes (pour leur bébé).

Elle veut s’acheter un mélange de produits pharmacopées soit 01 sac.

Elle veut améliorer son activité avec ses bénéfices. Mme ambitionne aider ses deux enfants pour leur étude (scolarité).
texts.en:
Mrs. MINATA is the leader of the group BELGIQUE. She is a married mother of 7 children aged 18 to 37, two of them still dependent and attending school. 

Mrs. Minata has been selling pharmacopoeia products and herbal teas for 17 years. She buys her stock in Ghana. Her customer base consists of men and women (for their babies).

She wants to buy one bag of various pharmacopoeia products. 

Mrs. Minata plans to use her profits to improve her activity. Her goal is to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy one bag of various pharmacopoeia products.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for the past three years and also earns additional income from buying and selling school supplies. Nancy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans through NWTF

Nancy is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 34 years old and married with six children. For the past two years, she has been running a general store in the Philippines and she also earns additional income from selling bananas. Sylvia works hard to provide for her family and has borrowed and repaid three previous loans from NWTF.

Sylvia is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional merchandise to sell. In the future, she hopes to repair and renovate her family's house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling spices in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional spices to sell for her business.

Shirley has been in this business for 20 years. Shirley earns additional income from her sari-sari (convenience) store.

Shirley has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional spices to sell.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 59 years old and married with five children.

Patricia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Patricia has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from selling rice and charcoal retail.

Patricia aspires to save money so she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 40 years old and married with four children.

Mary works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business selling rice and feed in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice and feed to sell.

Mary has borrowed and paid off five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her business for 28 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Mary aspires to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional sacks of rice and feed to sell.

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
Santa Lucia es el grupo integrado por 5 jóvenes de la ciudad de Ybycui, son jóvenes con ganas de salir adelante, poder estudiar y de esa forma poder ser alguien en la vida.
Nicolás forma parte del grupo, y comenta que decidió formar el grupo con sus amigos para poder tener un capital para trabajar e ir creciendo de esa forma mediante su propio esfuerzo. El trabaja en una granja haciendo todo tipo de trabajos. Es muy admirado por el ánimo de lucha que tiene.
Nicolás pide el crédito para la compra de herramientas que le serán de mucha ayuda para poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The Santa Lucia communal bank is comprised of five young people from the city of Ybycui.  These young people have a great desire to get ahead, to be able to get an education, and in this way be able to be someone in life.  

Nicolás is part of the group.  He says that he decided to form the group with his friends.  He did this in order to be able to work and keep growing in this way through his own effort.

He works on a farm doing all types of jobs.  He is much admired for his tenacious spirit.

Nicolás is requesting the loan to buy tools, which will be a big help in being able to continue working.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Yvoty Group

texts.es:
El comité lleva por nombre Yvoty, han asumido el compromiso de mantener unido al grupo y trabajar bajo un marco de honestidad y responsabilidad. Actualmente se encuentran en el Noveno ciclo, donde todas tratan y luchan por darle lo mejor a sus familias.
Felicia es una de estas mujeres, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que lucha por dar lo mejor que pueda a su familia, y que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de necesidades. Ella comenta que se dedica a las ventas, ya que tiene una despensa bien surtida, don de la mayoría de sus vecinos va. Gracias a su esfuerzo y su trabajo ha logrado crecer y tener un mejor negocio.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, lácteos, panificados, hortalizas, verduras y demás insumos para tener bien surtida su despensa.
texts.en:
The Yvoty communal bank has made the pledge to stay united as a group and to work within the framework of honesty and responsibility.  They are currently in their ninth cycle, where all of them try hard and struggle to give the best to their families.  

Felicia is one of these women.  She is a very hard-working and enterprising woman.  She struggles to give the best that she can to her family.  She does this so that they do not lack for any of the necessities.  She says that she devotes herself to sales.  She has a well-stocked grocery store, where most of her neighbors shop.  Thanks to her effort and her work she has managed to grow and to have a better business.

She is requesting the loan to buy drinks, dairy products, baked goods, vegetables, and the other supplies in order to have a well-stocked store.

loans.use: to buy drinks, dairy products, baked goods, vegetables, and the other supplies.

loans.name: Sop Sa Dieukeur 3 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement "SOPE SA DIEUKEUR 3" est un groupe de solidarité composé de femmes qui habitent dans la même localité.Elles se réunissent chaque semaine pour échanger sur des problèmes de la vie courante mais aussi pour collecter de l'épargne, faire la situation de leur crédit revolving.Elles mènent pour la plupart des activités de commerce de vêtements.Elle arrivent à subvenir à leurs besoins quotidiens et à satisfaire certains besoins de leurs familles avec les revenus générés par cette activité.Afin de renforcer leur fonds de commerce, elles sollicitent un pret de 450000f pour acheter des vêtements.
texts.en:
SOP SA DIEUKEUR 3 is a solidarity group of women who live in the same district. They get together every week to talk about current affairs, to collect for their savings, and to discuss their credit status. 

They mostly work in the sale of clothing, which brings in the income necessary to support themselves and their families. 

To strengthen their working capital, they are seeking a loan of 450,000F to buy clothing.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Wilson Rene

texts.es:
Wilson de 21 años de edad, es casado, tiene 1 hijo  y vive con su familia en una colonia de la Ciudad de San Pedro Sula.
Wilson se ha dedicado a trabajar con sus suegro haciendo trabajos con aluminio, pero quería poner en práctica  su habilidad de realizar los trabajos solo,   fue entonces que hace 2 años decidió establecer su propio negocio  en su casa, donde fabrica comales, rivales, tapones de desagüe, y tortillera en aluminio fundido. Con este negocio ha salido adelante con su familia, las ventas son rentables y espera seguir trabajando mucho para seguir ayudando.
Esta solicitando su primer  préstamo a ODEF para comprar la materia prima como aluminio para la fabricación de los comales, rivales, tapones de desagüe  etc. Con este préstamo ayudara a aumentar el inventario y vender más.
 Su meta es llegar a obtener un terreno donde pueda establecer su negocio, y poder generarle a su hija un patrimonio económico para el futuro.
texts.en:
Wilson is 21 years old, married, and has one child. He lives with his family in a subdivision of the city of San Pedro Sula.

Wilson worked with his in-laws by manufacturing products made from aluminum, but he wanted to utilize his skills so that he could produce these same items on his own. Two years ago, he decided to establish his own business from home where he produces griddles, cranks, drain plugs, and tortilla presses out of cast aluminum. With this business, he is able to move his family forward. His sales are profitable and he hopes to continue working hard so that he can continue helping his family.

Wilson is requesting his first loan from ODEF in order to buy raw materials, such as aluminum, for making griddles, cranks, drain plugs, and other items. This loan will help him increase his inventory and sell more. His goal is to acquire a plot of land where he can establish his business and generate financial assets that he can pass on to his daughter in the future.

loans.use: to buy aluminum.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 56 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Evelyn has been raising pigs for five years and also earns an additional income from selling frozen foods.

Evelyn is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream -- to save enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment for her fishing business.

Laura has been in this business for five years. Laura earns additional income from a manicure/pedicure service.

Laura has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment for her fishing business.

loans.name: Villa Armando Group

texts.es:
Este Comité llamado Villa Armando, tiene 15 integrantes, donde todas tienen una pequeña a la cual se dedican con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio. Las señoras se sienten muy emocionadas, la ayuda mutua entre ellas es constante y por sobre todo las inspira las ganas de seguir luchando por sus familias.
Petrona forma parte del grupo, y comenta que con mucho sacrificio está saliendo adelante y ayudando a su familia. Es una persona muy sacrificada y que trabaja mucho vendiendo la variedad de prendas que tiene. Comenta que trae prendas de todo tipo, lo que la ayuda pues siempre ofrece buena variedad a sus clientes.
Petrona pide la ayuda de fundación paraguaya y de Kiva para poder comprar prendas de invierno, ya que se acerca el frío y quiere poder cumplir con los pedidos que tendrá.
texts.en:
The Villa Armando communal bank is comprised of 15 members.  All of them have a little one to whom they devote themselves with great effort and sacrifice.  The ladies are very happy because they constantly help each other.  Above all else, they are inspired by the great desire to continue making great efforts for their families.

Petrona is part of the group.  She says that she is getting ahead and helping her family through a great deal of sacrifice.  She is a very self-sacrificing person, and she works a lot selling the variety of clothes that she has.  She says that she carries all types of clothes.  This helps her to always offer her customers a good variety.

Petrona is asking for help from the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva.  She wants to be able to buy winter clothes.  The cold is coming, and she wants to be able to fill the orders she will have.

loans.use: to buy winter clothes to sell.

loans.name: Crispin

texts.es:
Crispin tiene 50 años, está casado con Felicia, con quien tiene una hija, la que ya no vine con ellos. Crispin y Felicia viven en su casa propia, la que construyeron con mucho esfuerzo y se ubica en el distrito de Acobamba, Tarma.

Él se dedica a la agricultura hace más de 30 años, tiene terrenos propios en los que siembra verduras como; lechugas, espinacas, maíz, papa, coliflor y otras. En todo este tiempo aprendió que la venta de verduras es muy rentable, por eso hace 10 años también se dedica a la compra y venta de verduras. Adquiere su mercadería en su propio distrito, de vecinos y amigos que ya conoce hace muchos años. Crispin comercializa sus productos en la selva central, para ello viaja dos veces a la semana, recorriendo como dos horas de distancia. “En La Merced y San Ramón (selva central) los precios son más favorables por eso viajo constantemente”, menciona. Con la ayuda de su esposa y de operarios logra optimizar el trabajo de sus sembríos. Ahora piensa sembrar arvejas, flores (gladiolos) y maíz, para ello necesitará comprar semillas, bolsas de abonos y el pago de los operarios.

Esta es la primera vez que Crispin accede a un crédito con MFP, por eso se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Con el este dinero podrá comprar las bolsas de abono para sus sembríos de maíz, gladiolos y arvejas.
texts.en:
Crispin is 50 years old and married to Felicia. They have a daughter who no longer comes to see them. Crispin and Felicia live in their own home, which they built with a great deal of effort. They reside in the District of Acobamba, Tarma.

He has been a farmer for more than 30 years. Crispin has his own land where he grows vegetables such as lettuce, spinach, corn, potatoes, cauliflower, and other crops. Overall he has learned that selling vegetables is very profitable and has also spent 10 years buying and selling them. He acquires his merchandise within his district from neighbors and friends he has known for many years. Crispin sells his products in the central jungle, which requires him to travel twice a week over a distance that takes two hours to reach his destination. "In La Merced and San Ramón (towns in the central jungle) the prices are more favorable, so I travel frequently," remarks Crispin. With the help of his wife and from other workers, he is able to optimize his effort in the fields. He is now planning to plant peas, flowers (gladiolas), and corn, but he needs to purchase seeds and bags of compost, as well as pay his workers.

This is the first time Crispin has accessed a loan from MFP. For this reason, he promises to be punctual with his payments. The money will be used to purchase bags of compost for his corn, gladiola, and pea crops.

loans.use: to buy bags of compost.

loans.name: Mana

texts.fr: Revendeuse de cartes de recharges depuis 2000, Madame Mana est âgée  de 36ans et a 1 enfant de 20ans. Elle est à son sixième crédit de WAGES et n’a pas eu de difficulté à payer les 5 prêts reçus avant. Ce montant lui permettra d’acheter des cartes de recharges. Son approvisionnement se fait chez les grossistes de cartes de recharge et l’activité se fait dans un quartier de la place. Elle veut assurer l’avenir de la famille et agrandir l’activité.
texts.en: A reseller of phone recharge cards since 2000, Madame Mana is 36 years old and has one child, age 20. She is on her sixth loan from WAGES and hasn't had difficulty in repaying the five loans previously received. This sum will allow her to buy phone recharge cards. She stocks up at the phone card wholesalers and does business in an area of the square. She wants to see to her family's future and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy phone recharge cards.

loans.name: Barika

texts.fr:
Barika est une femme âgé(e) de 28 ans. Elle est mariée å un  chauffeur. Elle a 01 scolarisé âgé de 04ans.
Barika travaille comme revendeuse de sacs (friperies) depuis 2005 Elle vend à toutes personnes au bord de la route et elle est à son quatrième cycle de prêt à WAGES. Ce prêt qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter plus de sacs afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle veut agrandir l’activité et assurer l’éducation des enfants.
texts.en:
Barika is a 28 year old woman. She is married to a driver. She has one child in school who is four years old.
Barika has worked as a reseller of second-hand bags since 2005. She sells to anyone on the side of the road and she is in her fourth loan cycle with WAGES. This loan that she is asking for will allow her to buy more bags in order to better respond to the demands of her customers. She wants to grow her business and provide for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy second-hand bags.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr: Moussa est un jeune marié.Il n'a pas encore d'enfants.Il exerce le métier de taximan depuis bientôt cinq ans.Il subvient aux besoins de sa famille avec les revenus tirés de cette activité.Toutefois, son véhicule est tombé en panne de moteur et il est depuis lors confronté à des problèmes de prise en charge des dépenses d'entretien de sa famille. Il sollicite  ainsi un pret de 300000f pour acheter un moteur neuf.Son ambition est d'acquérir deux taxi dans le futur.
texts.en: Moussa is a young married man. He doesn't have children yet. He has been working as a taxi driver for nearly five years. He provides for his family with the profit he makes from his business. However, his car broke down from motor problems and since then he has been confronted with problems paying for household needs. He is asking for a loan of 300000 francs to buy a new motor. His ambition is to acquire two taxis in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new motor.

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits cosmétiques depuis 2008, Madame Amivi est maman de 02 enfants (âgés de 10 et 05ans) dont 01 est scolarisé. Pour contribuer aux dépenses du ménage, elle vend dans une boutique des produits de beauté et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Sa difficulté est la concurrence qu’elle rencontre sur le terrain.  Madame Amivi est à son premier crédit de WAGES et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des produits cosmétiques. Elle veut agrandir son activité et pouvoir satisfaire les besoins vitaux de la famille.
texts.en: A reseller of cosmetics since 2008, Madame Amivi is a mom to two children (aged five and ten years), one of whom is in school. To contribute to the household expenses, she sells beauty products in a store and stocks up in Lome. Her difficulty is the competition that she meets in the field. Madame Amivi is on her first loan from WAGES and is asking for this loan to buy cosmetics. She wants to grow her business and be able to satisfy the vital needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Edda Del Socorro

texts.es: Edda del Socorro de 61 años de edad tiene por actividad economica la una pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, herramienta que surgio por la necesidad de tener un medio de ingresos de econimicos  para su familia, en el cual tiene 30 años de experiencia, ya ha tenido credito con fundacion leon 2000 y ha demostrado responsabilidad, trabajadora, buena paga, y gracias al apoyo y la confianza que fundacion le ha brindado con los financaimiento ha podido invertir en capital de trabajo y de dicha forma surtir su pulperia, en esta ocacion esta solicitando el fiananciamiento para comprar productos de consumo diario como : arroz, azucar, café, pan, leche, huevos, frijoles, tiste, chicha, crema, condimentos, verduras, galletas, entre otros.
texts.en:
Edda del Socorro is 61 years old and has a store located in her home. This business started out of necessity so that she could have a source of income for her family. Edda now has 30 years of experience. She has taken out loans with Fundación León 2000 and has demonstrated responsibility, hard work, and a good payment record. Thanks to the support and trust provided by Fundación León 2000, she has been able to invest the loans as operating capital so that she can restock her store.

On this occasion, she is requesting a loan in order to buy everyday consumer products such as rice, sugar, coffee, bread, milk, eggs, beans, "tiste" (a popular Nicaraguan beverage made from corn and cacao), "chicha" (another beverage made from corn), cream, condiments, vegetables, cookies, and other items.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products for her store.

loans.name: Ramongo Group

texts.fr:
Mme FATOUMATA est la responsable du groupe RAMONGO. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a16ans et le moins âgé a 04ans.02 vont à l’école et elle a 5 personnes en charge.

Mme vend de l’atiéké (couscous de manioc) depuis 03ans. Elle s’approvisionne à la gare de train. Ses clients sont ses amis, voisins, hommes et femmes. 

Elle veut s’acheter  05 sacs d’akiéké.

Mme veut épargner ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne ouvrir un grand magasin pour son activité.
texts.en:
Madame Fatoumata is the leader of the RAMONGO group. She is married and mother of three children. The oldest is 16 years old and the youngest is 4. Two go to school and she has five people in her care.

Madame has sold akieke (manioc couscous) for three years. She stocks up at the train station. Her customers are her friends and neighbors, men and women.

She wants to buy five bags of akieke.

Madame wants to save her profits. She aspires to open a large store for her business.

loans.use: to buy five bags of akieke (manioc couscous).

loans.name: Zulaiho

texts.ru: Зулайхо добрая женщина, она замужем и на воспитании имеет шестерых детей, из них четверо несовершеннолетние. Зулайхо всегда старается создать уют в своей семье и для этого усердно работает. Более 13 лет она занимается купле- продажей детской и женской одежды. Она также продает женские ткани. Её любящая дочка работает в больнице медсестрой, также в свободное время помогает матери. Зулайхо приобретает товар на центральном рынке «Корвон», затем продает на рынке «Дусти». Зулайхо хотела бы получить займ для покупки нового товара с целью пополнения оборотного капитала.
texts.en: Zulaiho is a good woman.  She's married and raising six children, four of whom have not come of age.  She works diligently, always trying to bring comfort to her family.   She has been a vendor of women's and children's clothing for more than thirteen years.  She also sells fabrics for women.  Her beloved daughter works as a nurse in a hospital and also helps her mother out in her spare time.  Zulaiho buys her merchandise in the Korvon central market and then sells it in the Dusti market.  She would like to receive a loan to buy new merchandise so she can supplement her working capital.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La socia Paulina vive en la hermosa ciudad de Calca y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. (La ciudad de Calca y se caracteriza por tener hermosos paisajes por ser una zona turística, ganadera y agrícola). La socia Paulina pertenece al banco comunal “Clorinda Matto de Turner” y este banco está situado en el distrito de Calca en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia Paulina se dedica al comercio minorista, ella compra y vende frazadas y colchones. La socia invertirá en la compra de mercadería como por ejemplo frazadas. La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Paulina lives and works in the beautiful town of Calca which is known for its lovely countryside, its tourism industry, livestock, and agriculture. She is a member of the Clorinda Matto de Turner Community Bank which is located in Calca district, in the province of Urubamba, Cusco department.

Paulina earns her living buying and selling blankets and mattresses. She wishes to buy more merchandise, blankets for example. She is grateful for this invaluable loan and promises to make the repayments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: buy more merchandise such as blankets

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.es:
La socia Antonieta,continua dedicandose a su negocio de restaurante ella prepara almuezos y platos extras,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio ,la socia trabaja en su negocio todos los dias,la socia es una persona responsable con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el prestamo para la compra de insumos para su negocio como arroz y aceite.
texts.en:
Antonieta continues to run her restaurant where she makes lunches and other meals. She’s had this business for many years and all is going well thanks to the effort she puts in every day. She is a responsible person with a great desire to continue her work so that she can help her family get ahead.

Antonieta is seeking a loan to buy supplies such as rice and oil.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice and oil

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 43 years old and married with five children.

Marilou works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 14,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store. She has been in this business for 2 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Marilou aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 41 years old and married with six children.

Arlene earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase medicines and vaccines for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for 5 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Santiago Bueras Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Santiago Bueras” está conformado por 19 emprendedores que se dedican al rubro del comercio , específicamente venta de ropa, venta de perfumes, productos naturales, venta de pan amasado, costuras, almacén, artesanía, servicios entre otros. Todos pertenecientes a la comuna de Peñalolén, ubicada en la cuidad de Santiago.
Juan, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en la última fila, ocupando el tercer lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste un poleron de color azul, su cabello lo usa corto.
Juan se dedica al rubro de venta de empanadas, pan y masas en general, desde hace 5 meses, comenta que trabaja todos los días desde las  8ºº hasta las 20ºº horas, sus productos los ofrece en el negocio de su hermano.
La mercadería e ingredientes que va necesitando los compra en diferentes distribuidoras y supermercados a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará harina, aceite, levadura, pasas, condimentos, para la preparación de sus empanadas y masas en general.
Unas de sus metas son continuar con el negocio, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Juan vive con su hermano quien le facilita las ventas de sus masas en su local. Sus sueños son crecer como microempresario y poder tener un local.
El está muy contento y agradecido de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que el crédito le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Además se siente cómodo con el grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, lo cual lo motiva a seguir participando en la institución. Comenta además que las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones le han servido para invertir mejor en su negocio.
Peñalolén se localiza al oriente de la región metropolitana. Cuenta con diversos atractivos tales como viñas, edificios considerados patrimonio histórico y sitios naturales de excursión, elementos que están transformando a esta comuna en un nuevo panorama turístico dentro de la región Metropolitana.
texts.en:
This Communal Bank is called "Santiago Bueras" and consists of 19 entrepreneurs who engage in the retail trade. More specifically, they sell items such as clothing, perfumes, natural products, "pan amasado" (Chilean kneaded bread), handsewn clothing, groceries, handicrafts, as well as provide services and other amenities. All of the members are from the community of Peñalolén, which is located in the city of Santiago.

Juan is a member of the Communal Bank group. In the photo, he is standing in the last row in the third position from right to left. He is seen wearing a blue pullover and his hair is cut short. Juan has been selling empanadas, bread, and pastries for the past five months. He says that he works every day from 8am to 8pm. His products are offered at his brother's business. The supplies and ingredients that he needs are purchased from different distributors and supermarkets at low cost, which is convenient for him financially. His loan will be used to buy flour, oil, yeast, raisins, and condiments for preparing empanadas and pastries. One of his goals is to continue his business in order to generate more income. This will enable him to have a better quality of life.

Juan lives with his brother who helps sell the pastries by offering them in his shop. His dreams are to grow as a micro-entrepreneur and to have a shop of his own. Juan is pleased with and appreciative of the opportunity Fondo Esperanza has provided by giving him a loan to invest in his business. In addition, he feels comfortable with his Communal Bank group and is determined to continue participating in the organization. He says that the training classes conducted during the meetings have helped him to do a better job of investing in his business.

Peñalolén is located west of the Metropolitana region. There are various attractions such as vineyards, historical buildings, and natural excursion sites. These elements have transformed this community into one of the newest tourist destinations in the Metropolitana region.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, yeast, raisins, and spices.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 49 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Edna runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

She has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items, such as sugar, milk, soap, toothpaste, etc.

In the future, Edna would like to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: La Alborada Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “La Alborada” está conformado por 18 emprendedores que se dedican al rubro del comercio, específicamente cosmetología, venta de ropa, feriantes, costuras, venta de artículos plásticos, pintores, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos perteneciente a la comuna de la Florida, ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Claudia, tesorera del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie al fondo de la fila, ocupando el tercer lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste un chaleco de color rosado y en sus manos sostiene una carpeta, su pelo es castaño claro y lo usa tomado.
Ella se dedica a la preparación de comida, específicamente sopaipillas. Se desempeña desde hace 7 meses. Comenta que trabaja sola y que ofrece sus productos a sus clientes en  su propia casa, atiende todos los días y su horario de trabajo lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad, ya que sus hijos son pequeños.
Su mercadería la compra usualmente en supermercados, distribuidoras de masas a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará masas, cajas de aceite, mostaza, kétchup, para abastecer su negocio.
Sus metas son surgir y ver la posibilidad de aumentar sus ventas incorporando la venta de completos, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Claudia vive junto a sus 2 hijos, Pablo de 5 años de edad y Kevin de 2 años de edad. Sus sueños son arrendar un local junto con su hermano vendiendo todo tipo de comida rápida.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades, intereses, lo cual también le ha servido como un momento de distracción. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
La Florida es una comuna ubicada al suroriente de Santiago, capital de Chile, región Metropolitana. Su población actual es muy diversa, representando a todos los sectores socioeconómicos (alto, medio alto, medio y medio bajo). La zona cuenta con una activa vida comercial, la que se manifiesta en la existencia de varios nuevos centros comerciales. Es un sector que ha tenido un explosivo crecimiento demográfico en los últimos años.
texts.en:
The communal bank, "La Alborada" (Dawn), is comprised of eighteen entrepreneurs who make their living in commerce, specifically cosmetology, clothing sales, markets, sewing, the sale of plastic items, painting, and various other services. They all belong to the municipality of La Florida, located in the city of Santiago.

Claudia is the treasurer of communal bank group. She can be seen standing third from the right in the back row, wearing a pink sweater and holding a folder. Her hair is light brown and she is wearing it up. She makes her living preparing food, specifically sopaipillas. She has been doing this for the past seven months. She tells us that she works alone and that she offers her products to clients in her own home. She attends clients every day, though her work schedule varies according to her availability, since her children are little.

She usually buys her merchandise in supermarkets, low-cost distributors of flour, for economic convenience. With this loan, she will buy flour, cartons of oil, mustard, and ketchup to stock her business. Her goals are to get ahead and to increase her sales, incorporating the sale of completos (Chilean hot dogs served with avocado and mayonnaise), in order to generate more income, since with this she will be able to pursue a better quality of life.

Claudia lives with her two sons, Pablo, who is five, and Kevin, who is two. Her dreams are to rent a place with her brother and sell all types of fast food.

She is very content and grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza is bringing her, since it has permitted her to invest in her business. Moreover, she feels very comfortable with the organization and the other entrepreneurs in the communal bank group, since they share a variety of activities and interests—which has also presented moments of distraction. The training she has received in meetings has taught her to administer her business in the best possible way.

La Florida is a municipality located to the southeast of Santiago, capital of Chile, Metropolitan region. Their current population is very diverse, representing all socioeconomic sectors (upper, upper-middle, middle, and lower-middle). The region has a very active commercial life, which is manifested in the existence of various new commercial centers. There has been explosive demographic growth in the sector during the last few years.

loans.use: to buy flour, boxes of oil, mustard, and ketchup to stock their business.

loans.name: Nayruth Noeli

texts.es:
Nayruth nació en el distrito de Calca provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco. (Calca se encuentra a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco). Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad de donde nació y pertenece al banco comunal “Clorinda Matto de Turner” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

Nayruth se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas, ella viaja una vez a la semana a la ciudad de Yanatile de donde compra fruta. Ella de retorno a la ciudad de Calca distribuye o vende a diferentes vendedoras de los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Calca. 

En esta oportunidad Nayruth requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo plátanos, papayas y otras frutas de acuerdo a la temporada.
texts.en:
Nayruth was born in the district of Calca, in the province of Calca, which is in the department fo Cusco; Calca is located 45 minutes from the city of Cusco. She currently lives in the city where she was born and belongs to the Associación Arariwa communal bank "Clorinda Matto de Turner."

Nayruth works in buying and selling fruits. She travels once a week to the city of Yanatile, where she buys fruit. Upon returning to the city of Calca, she distributes/sells to different fruit sellers in different markets in the city of Calca.

At this time, Nayruth needs a loan to purchase merchandise like, for example, bananas, papayas, and other fruits in accordance with the season.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise like, for example, bananas, papayas, and other fruits in accordance with the season.

loans.name: Ave

texts.en:
Ave is 46 years old, and is married with 3 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Ave has a fishing business in the Philippines. Ave requested a loan of 27,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy materials like wood, paint, shovels, nylon, and fishing nets for her business.

Ave has been in this business for 21 years. In the future, Ave would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy materials for her business.

loans.name: Diding

texts.en:
Diding is 38 years old and married with 10 children. With 4 children in school, Diding works very hard to provide for them.

Diding runs a pearl vending business in the Philippines and requested a loan of 19,500 Philippines pesos through NWTF to buy assorted pearls and other accessories to sell. She has been in this business for 28 years.

In the future, Diding would like to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy assorted pearls and other accessories to sell.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Dolores requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business.

She has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Dolores would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Faizullo

texts.ru: Пятнадцать  лет тому назад добрый и трудолюбивый человек под именем  Файзулло начал свою деятельность в сфере сельского хозяйства. Он начал свой бизнес с надеждой получения прибыли для  содержания семьи и обучения своих детей, чтобы они выросли образованными и культурными людьми. Ранее он был в России на заработках и накопив денег он начал данный бизнес. Файзулло заботливый семьянин и на воспитании имеет четверых детей. В основном он занимается  выращиванием  сельхозкультур, таких  как картофель и пшеница. Его дехканство  приносит ему хороший доход и он хочет расширить его и стать успешным фермером.  Файзулло  хотел бы получить займ для покупки минеральных  удобрений  с целью производства  хорошего урожая. Он надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: This good and hardworking man named Faizullo began farming fifteen years ago. He is a caring family man and has four children. Faizullo started his farm in hopes of gaining a stable source of income for his family. It is especially important to him to be able to educate his children, so that they would grow up to be cultured and civilized people. Earlier he spent some time working in Russia and after saving enough money Faizullo bought farm land where he grows potatoes and wheat. His farm yields good yearly profits and he wants to further expand his business and become an even more successful farmer. Faizullo is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer to ensure a good harvest. He hopes for your help and charity.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Hanilet

texts.en:
Hanilet is 22 years old and single. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Hanilet runs a pearl vending business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy assorted pearls and other materials for making accessories.

Hanilet has been in this business for eight years.

In the future, Hanilet would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy assorted pearls and other materials for making accessories to sell.

loans.name: San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
El comité  “San Sebastián”, se conformó con 10 mujeres de la ciudad de Villa Ygatimi, están con en el segundo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya, y la meta de cada una de ellas es seguir creciendo y ayudando a sus familias.
Todas las miembros se dedican a la cría y venta de animales de corral, como ser gallinas, cerdos, patos, ovejas, etc. Con este trabajo todas ellas ayudan a sus familias a salir adelante.
Mariza una de las miembros, solicita el crédito para la compra de balanceados para sus animales, para que de esa forma pueda seguir trabajando y dando a sus familia lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
The communal bank "San Sebastian" is made up of 10 women from the city of Villa Ygatimi.  They are in their second loan cycle in the Enterprising Women Program of the Fundacion Paraguaya.   Each one of them wants to continue to grow and help their family. 

All of the members of this group work raising and selling farm animals, such as hens, pigs, ducks, sheep, etc.  With this work, they help their families to get ahead.

Mariza is one of the members.  She is requesting a loan to buy nutritionally balanced feed for her animals so that she can continue to work and provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Imelda has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

She has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Imelda would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Saidaskar

texts.ru: Саидаскар трудолюбивый человек, он женат и на воспитании имеет пятерых детей. У него высшее образование, он окончил Худжандский Государственный Университет им. Б. Гафуров факультет Физики города Худжанда в 1996г. С 1996 года до 2008 работал  в средней школы №6.  Проработав в школе он не смог содержать свою семью.  Саидаскар был вынужден бросить школу и поехать в Россию, чтобы заработать деньги для  содержания семьи. Приехав на Родину, он опять начал заниматься скотоводством и земледелием. В основном он выращивает пшеницу, картофель, и другие сельхозпродукты. Уже более 10  лет он занимается этим бизнесом. Его жена и взрослые дети  помогают ему в ведении бизнеса. Полученный урожай он  продает оптом из дома. Саидаскар  хотел бы получить займ для приобретения минеральных  удобрений. Также он хочет приобрести скот для увеличения поголовья скота.
texts.en: Saidaskar is a hardworking man, he is married and is raising five children. Saidaskar has a bachelor of science degree in physics from Khudjan State University which he received in 1996. Between 1996 and 2008 he worked in the high school #6, but a teacher's salary was insufficient to support his large family. As a result Saidaskar was forced to quit his teacher position and go to Russia for work. After returning back to Tajikistan he has started his own farm, where he primarily grows wheat, potatoes and other staple crops as well as raises farm animals. Saidaskar has more then ten years of farming experience and his wife and older children help with the work load. The harvest is usually sold whole sale from home to resellers. Saidaskar wants to take out this loan to purchase fertilizer and some more cattle for his herd.

loans.use: To purchase of mineral fertilizers and cattle

loans.name: Kumushoi

texts.ru: Десять  лет тому назад трудолюбивая женщина  под именем  Кумушой,  начала свою деятельность в сфере выращивания сельхозкультур. Она начала свой бизнес с надеждой получения прибыли для  содержания семьи, благоустройства дома  и обучения своих детей, чтобы вырастить их  воспитанными и образованными людьми. Кумушой вместе с мужем Хусан живут более 20 лет. Муж её заботливый семьянин и на воспитании они имеют троих детей. В основном она выращивает ячмень на площади 4 га условно поливной земли, также она содержит крупный рогатый скот. Условия для улучшения жилищных условий требуют больших затрат, поэтому она отправила двух сыновей в трудовую миграцию на заработки. Кумушой хотела бы получить займ для покупки строительных материалов и оплаты труда мастеров при постройке дома. Она  надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en:
Ten years ago, a hardworking woman named Kumush began activity in the area of crop cultivation. She started her business in the hopes of making a profit to support her family, for home improvement, and the education of their children in order to raise them as educated people. Kumush and her husband have lived in Husan over 20 years. Her husband, a caring, educated family man and her are raising three children.

Basically, she grows barley on 4 hectares of conventionally irrigated land, as well as cattle. Improving living conditions is costly, so she sent two sons to work abroad. Kumush would like to get a loan to buy building materials and pay workers in the construction of her house. She looks forward to your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to repair her house

loans.name: Alipia

texts.es:
La socia Alipia,continua dedicandose a la confección de chompas de lana, ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia elabora sus chompas para luego venderlo en las ferias de los fines de semana en la ciudad de Cusco,la socia es una persona responsable con muchas ganas de continuar adelante por su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de materiales como lana de diferentes tipos de colores.


La socia se siente agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Alipia is continuing with her business selling wool sweaters.  She has already had this business for a number of years, and it is going very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her business each day.  Alipia makes sweaters to later sell in the markets on the weekends in the city of Cusco.  She is a responsible person who has a strong desire to continue forward with her family.

Alipia is requesting a loan to buy materials such as woolen yarn in a variety of colors.

Alipia is grateful for the opportunity that she is being provided through these means, and she pledges to make her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy woolen yarn in a variety of colors

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité  “La Esperanza” Actualmente se encuentra  en el segundo ciclo, con diez integrantes. El grupo empezó, demostrando unión y solidaridad entre las compañeras; quienes poseen actividad  económica y son muy trabajadoras. Este grupo está integrado por mujeres indígenas.
Olga es la presidenta del grupo, y ella comenta que se dedica a la cría y venta de animales de corral, como ser gallinas y cerdos. Comenta que es un trabajo muy sacrificado ya que es un trabajo de tiempo completo, pues todo el día está pendiente de sus animales. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que siempre se esfuerza al máximo para poder ayudar a su familia.
Olga solicita el crédito para la compra de balanceados para sus animales, ya que quiere tener un buen stock de ellos.
texts.en:
The “La Esperanza” (Hope) committee is in its second cycle with ten members.  The group began with unity and mutual support among the members who have economic activities and are very hardworking.  This group is made up of indigenous women.

Olga is group president. She comments that she raises barnyard animals to sell like chickens and pigs.  She comments that it’s very demanding work because she must care for her animals all day.  She’s a very hardworking, enterprising person who always strives to the maximum to be able to help her family.

Olga is asking for a loan to buy animal feed for her animals because she wants to have a good stock of it.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is 32 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Jasmin has been running a charcoal retail business in the Philippines for four years and also earns an income from a sari sari (general) store. She has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell. She has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Jasmin aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mavliddin

texts.ru: Мавлиддин очень трудолюбивый и целеустремлённый мужчина, он женат. Дети совершеннолетние. Условия жизни у них были очень тяжелые. Самых ранних лет он  пастил  мелкий рогатый скот. После занятий в школе работал на поле, чтобы заработать деньги для содержания семь, и чтобы помогать своим родителям. Повзрослев женился и опять таки занимался животноводством и работал на поле. В основном он  выращивает пшеницу, кукурузу, горох и другие сельхозпродукты. Уже более 20  лет он занимается этим бизнесом. Жена и сыновья помогают ему в ведении бизнеса. Полученный урожай он  продает местным жителям по более низкой цене чем на базаре. Большая часть населения данного района приобретают пшеницу, а затем на мельнице получают муку и выпекают хлеб для личного пользования. Мавлиддин хочет получить побольше доходов и сыграть свадьбу младшего сына. Мавлиддин  хотел бы получить займ для покупки скота, чтобы откармливать и реализовать. Таким образом хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить доход для улучшения своего домохозяйства.
texts.en: Mavliddin is a very hardworking and goal-oriented man. He is married and has adult children. Mavliddin always had a hard life. As a child he raised sheep and goats. Every day after school he would also work in the fields to help his parents support their family. After Mavliddin grew up and married he continued to farm and raise animals for a living. For the last 20 years he has primarily grown wheat, corn, peas and other staple crops. His wife and sons help with the work load and the family sells their harvest to the local residents below market price. Most people in the region purchase their own wheat and then have it ground at the mills and bake their own bread. This year Mavliddin wants to get higher profits so that he can pay for the wedding of his youngest son. Mavliddin want to take out a loan to purchase cattle which he will fatten and sell for meat at the market. He will use leftover profits to expand his business and improve the farm.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Nelva

texts.es: Nelva es socia del Bancomunal Milenio y tiene 30 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de dos hijas. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 7 años y es negociante ambulatoria donde vende materiales para el aseo, tijeras, mercería, hilo y agujas, un poco de todo. Ella dice que su experiencia en FINCA Perú ha sido muy interesante, le ha servido mucho, especialmente cuando mis compañeras me ofrecieron el cargo de ser Presidenta de la Junta Directiva de mi Bancomunal, eso me ayudó a superar mis debilidades. En todo este tiempo como socia de FINCA Perú ella ha aprendido mucho sobre la responsabilidad, puntualidad, solidaridad, y ha fortalecida mucho sus valores. Su sueño para el futuro es tener su propia bodega. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su negocio como productos de bisutería y del aseo.
texts.en:
Nelva, 30, is a member of the “Milenio” (Millennium) communal bank.  She has a spouse and two daughters.  She’s been a member of Finca Perú for 7 years and is a street merchant selling cleaning supplies, scissors, notions, thread and needles; a little bit of everything.  It has served her well, especially when her fellow members offered her the role of communal bank governing board president which helped her overcome her weaknesses.

In all this time as member of Finca Perú she’s learned much about responsibility, punctuality and mutual support and she’s strengthened her values very much.  

Her dream for the future is to have a store of her own.  She will use the loan she’s requesting to buy merchandise for her business like costume jewelry items and cleaning supplies.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Augusta

texts.es:
La socia María Augusta,continua dedicandose a la confeccion de ropa como chompas de lana ,la socia tiene un pequeño taller en su casa donde realiza todos sus trabajos ,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia,ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de materiales para su negocio como lanas de diferente color.
   
La socia se siente agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
María Augusta continues making clothes like wool sweaters.  She has a small workshop at home where she does her work.  She’s a responsible, dedicated person who very much wants to continue to work for her family.  She’s been in this business for several years now and has done well because of the effort she puts into it.

She’s asking for the loan to buy supplies for her business like wool in assorted colors.  She feels grateful for the opportunity provided through this means and commits to make her payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy assorted wool in various colors.

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтиёр мужчина в возрасте 46 лет, женат имеет четверых детей. Он живет в городской местности. Бахтиёр более 10 лет занимается хлопко перерабатывающем цехе . Кроме этого он занимается выращиванием скота. Его жена домохозяйка, но когда Бахтиёр на работе она ухаживает за скотом. Раньше Бахтиёр занимался только выращиванием скота, тогда доход от этого бизнеса  хватало на их семейные нужды, но со временем их дети выросли, им надо  давать хорошое образование, поэтому Бахтиёру пришлось заниматься и этим делом тоже. Он арендовал хлопко перерабатовающий цех и  работает на этом цехе.  Бахтиёр берет кредит, для ремонта оборудования этого цеха. Он очень благодарен таким организациям, что с их помощью люди со средним и низким уровнем жизни могут улучшить свои условия проживания.
texts.en: Bahtiyor is a 46 year old man, he is married and has four children. He lives in the city and has been managing a cotton processing factory for the last ten years. Bahtiyor also raises cattle for sale. His wife is a home maker and takes care of their cows while Bahtiyor is at work. In the past cattle raising was their primary source of income but now the children grew up and much more money is required for their education. To keep up with his family's needs Bahtiyor rented a cotton processing plant and works there himself. He is taking out this loan to finance repairs to the equipment at the factory. Bahtiyor is very grateful to Kiva for their assistance, since Kiva's loan program for people with low and middle income really help them to improve their lives.

loans.use: to repair his cotton processing plant

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa es socia del Bancomunal Milenio y tiene 56 años de edad, es viuda y madre de un hijo varón. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace muchos años y se dedica a la venta de cereales, el ajo y la papa en las ferias de la cuidad. Durante todo este tiempo Rosa ha aprendido mucho sobre la administración de su negocio, como ahorrar, la responsabilidad y puntualidad. Su sueño para el futuro es superarse y progresar. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de cereales para que los pueda vender en su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa, 56, is a member of the “Milenio” (Millennium) communal bank.  She’s a widow and mother of a son. She’s been a member of Finca Perú for many years and she sells cereals, garlic and potatoes in the city’s street markets. 

During all this time, Rosa has learned much about running her business, how to save, responsibility and punctuality.  Her dream for the future is to improve and to make progress. 

She will use the requested loan to buy cereals to be able to sell in her business.

loans.use: to buy cereal to sell.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela es socia del Bancomunal Milenio y tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y es madre de dos hijos (un varón y una nena). Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 2 años y se dedica a los bordados. Las lecciones que ella más ha aprendido durante estos años como socia de FINCA Perú son como ahorrar y a ser puntual. Su sueño para el futuro es hacer mejoras para su casa y progresar al lado de su familia. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra materiales que utiliza para sus bordados como hilos, telas, agujas.
texts.en:
Adela, 38, is a member of the “Milenio” (Millennium) communal bank.  She’s married and the mother of two children (a boy and a girl).  She’s been a member of Finca Perú for two years and she does embroidery.

The lessons she’s learned best during the years she’s been a member of Finca Perú are how to save and to be punctual.  Her dream for the future is to do some home improvements and to make progress alongside her family.

She will use the loan to buy supplies she uses for her embroidery like thread, fabric and needles.

loans.use: to buy embroidery supplies.

loans.name: Uynus

texts.ru: Юнус мужчина в возрасте 51 года, хороший семьянин  любящий муж и отец, женат, имеет на иждивении 2 детей. Он работает в железнодорожном вокзале сварщиком. Имеет 16 летний стаж работы в этой сфере. Супруга работает няней в частном доме. Старший сын Юнуса находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Он тоже помогает родителям присылая им деньги. Ведь Юнусу нужно воспитывать 2 младших детей которые еще учатся в школе. Не давно старшая дочь Юнуса родила мальчика, а средняя дочь родила девочку. По нашим традициям они 40 дней должны быть у матери. Этот кредит Юнуса второй по счету. Он показал себя с хорошей стороны и ни разу не нарушал условия кредитования. Очередной кредит хочет получить для проведения мероприятия внуков (гахворабандон). Юнус с супругой надеются на вашу помощь и поддержку и благодарны вам.
texts.en:
Uynus, a 51-year-old good family man, loving husband and father, is married and has two dependent children. He works at a railway station as a welder. He has 16 years of experience in this field. His wife is a nanny in a private home. Uynus's eldest son works in Russia and also helps his parents by sending them money. Indeed, Uynus has to raise two younger children who are still in school.

Not long ago, Uynus's eldest daughter gave birth to a boy, and the middle daughter gave birth to a baby girl. According to our traditions, they need to be with their mothers for 40 days. This loan is Yunus's second loan. He has shown his good side and has never violated the lending terms. He wants to get another loan to put on an event for his grandchildren (a 'cradle-feast' ceremony). Yunus and his wife are hoping for your help and support and thank you.

loans.use: to put on an event for his grandchildren.

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.es: Apolonia es socia del Bancomunal Primavera y tiene 52 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 6 hijos (4 mujeres y 2 hijos varones). Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 5 años y se dedica a la venta de golosinas. Durante todo este tiempo trabajando con FINCA Perú, Apolonia ha aprendido a como ahorrar, a ser siempre  puntual, a crear y profundizar las relaciones con las otras socias de su Bancomunal para tener un ambiente muy solidario. Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa propia. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de golosinas como chocolates, caramelos, galletas, refrescos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Apolonia, 52, is a member of the “Primavera” (Spring) communal bank.  She has a spouse and is the mother of six children (four girls and two boys).  She’s been a member of Finca Perú for five years and she works selling snacks.  

During all this time working with Finca Perú Apolonia has learned how to save, to be punctual always and to create and deepen relationships with other communal bank members in order to have a mutually supportive environment.  

Her dream for the future is to own a house.  She will use the requested loan to buy snacks like chocolates, candy, cookies and soft-drinks for her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks like chocolates, candy, cookies, soft-drinks, etc.

loans.name: Yrami Ines

texts.es:
La socia Yrami nació en la ciudad de Calca y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella tiene 31  años edad y tiene un hijo. (La ciudad de Calca y se caracteriza por tener hermosos paisajes por ser una zona turística, ganadera y agrícola). 

La socia Yrami pertenece al banco comunal “Clorinda Matto de Turner” de la Asociación Arariwa y las reuniones son cada treinta. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la venta productos de primera necesidad y le va muy bien gracias al desempeño que pone en su negocio. La socia Yrami tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes donde vende sus productos como por ejemplo refrescos, leche, fideos, arroz, azúcar y otros más. En esta oportunidad Yrami accede al crédito para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de azúcar, sacos de fideos y sacos de arroz.
texts.en:
Member Yrami was born in the city of Calca and lives in the same city where she was born. She is 31 years old and has one child. The city of Calca is known for its beautiful landscape and for being an area where there is tourism, stockbreeding, and agriculture. 

Member Yrami belongs to the communal bank Clorinda Matto de Turner, of Asociación Arariwa, and the meetings are every month. She has been selling essential goods for several years, and it is going very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her business. Member Yrami has a small grocery store where she sells her products, such as soft drinks, milk, noodles, rice, sugar, and other items. This time Yrami is requesting the loan in order to purchase merchandise, such as sacks of sugar, sacks of noodles, and sacks of rice.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise, such as sacks of sugar, sacks of noodles, and sacks of rice.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de restaurant,el junto con su esposa preparan desayunos,almuerzos y cenas y tambien es dueño de una agrupacion musical,el socio anima matrimonios,bautizos y cumpleaños,el socio trabaja desde las 5:00 p.m hasta las 2:00 a.m,por medio de sus negocios el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de restaurant y tambien ampliar el negocio de su agrupacion musical.El socio solicita el credito para comprar productos para cocinar para su restaurant como arroz,carne,pollo y verduras.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The partner continues to dedicate himself to his restaurant business; along with his wife they prepare breakfasts, lunches and dinners. He is also the owner of a music group.  He plays at weddings, baptisms and birthdays, he works from 5pm to 2am. Thanks to his businesses he has been able to support his children. The partner's dream is to expand his business, both the restaurant and his music group. He is asking for a loan to purchase cooking supplies for his restaurant like rice, meat, chicken and vegetables. The partner is grateful for the loan and promises to meet his repayments.

loans.use: purchase cooking supplies for his restaurant like rice, meat, chicken and vegetables.

loans.name: Rikhard

texts.ru:
Рихард торгует женской одеждой. Его торговая точка расположена в торговом центре на втором этаже. Занимается Рихард этим бизнесом уже три года. В планах - открыть еще одну тогровую точку осенью.

Рихард хочет развививать свой бизнес дальше, чобы обеспечить хорошее образование своим троим детям. Недавно у Рихарда умерли родители и оставили ему дом в наследство. Он наменер сдавать этот дом под бизнес, так как дом расположен в хорошем месте. Таким образов он сможет получать  дополнительный доход.

Рихард просит предоставить ему кредит в размере 10,000 гривен на закупку товара - моложежных блуз, джинсов, кофт и пр.
texts.en:
Rikhard sells women's clothing. His outlet is located on the second floor of a shopping center. Rikhard has been engaged in this business for three years. He plans to open another shop in the fall.

Rikhard wants to develop his business further, in order to provide a good education for his three children. Recently, Rikhard's parents died and left him a house as an inheritance. He intends to rent out the home, as the house is situated in a good location. Thus, he will be able to earn extra income.

Rikhard is asking for a loan of 10,000 hryvnia to buy goods - youth blouses, jeans, jackets, etc.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Victoria Zenina

texts.es: Victoria es socia del Bancomunal Primavera y tiene 52 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de una hija. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 10 años y es técnica de salud, y también tiene un negocio propio donde se vende ropa. Durante este tiempo que viene trabajando con FINCA Perú, Victoria ha aprendido mucho sobre la responsabilidad tanto en los negocios como dentro de su familia. Su sueño para el futuro es que su negocio crezca. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más ropa para su negocio.
texts.en:
Victoria, 52, is a member of the “Primavera” (Spring) communal bank.  She has a spouse and is the mother of a daughter.  She’s been a member of Finca Perú for ten years and she’s a health technician; she also has her own business where she sells clothes.

During the time she’s been working with Finca Perú, Victoria has learned much about responsibility both in business and within her family.  

Her dream for the future is that her business grows.  She will use the requested loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Jamolidin

texts.ru: Чамолидин женат и ответственный отец четверых детей. Жена занимается домохозяйством и в свободное время помогает мужу, который занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур. Чамолидин очень любит свою семью и всегда о них заботится и с этой целью усердно работает день за днем. Чамолиддин также занимается купле- продажей скота. Чамолиддин опытный человек в этой сфере бизнеса. За счет животноводства он кормит свою семью. Из- за неблагополучной погоды Чамолиддин не смог получить хороший урожай для откорма скота. Несмотря на все эти трудности продвигал свой бизнес вперед.  Чамолиддин хотел бы получить займ для покупки 8 голов крупного рогатого скота для откорма и перепродажи. Чамолиддин ждет вашу помощь и надеется на это.
texts.en: Jamolidin is married and a responsible father of four children. His wife is a home maker and helps his husband take care of the farm and the animals. Jamolidin loves his family and in order to provide for their happiness he is willing to work night and day. One of the main sources of income for them is cattle sales and Jamolidin has a lot of experience in this type of business. This year, due to bad weather, Jamolidin wasn't able to harvest enough feed for his cows but despite this set back he overcame the difficulties and his business persevered. Now he wants to take out a loan to purchase 8 more animals for fattening and resale. Jamolidin is waiting for your help and very much hopes it will be possible.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Avelino

texts.es:
El socio Avelino continua con su negocio de musica ,el es director musical , ya son varios años que se dedica  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio ,el socio toca con su agrupacion en los distintos compromisos que le solicitan como matrimonios, fientas de 15 años entre otros,el socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa con muchas ganas de continuar adelante por su familia,

EL socio solicita el credito para comprar algunos instrumentos que necesita como una guitarra.

 
El socio se siente agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Member Avelino continues with his music business. He is a musical director, and he has been in this business for several years. It is going well thanks to the effort he puts into his business. He plays with his group at different events where for which he is hired, such as weddings, 15th birthday celebrations, and others. This member is a responsible and hardworking man, who is very eager to keep moving forward for his family.

He is requesting the loan to purchase several instruments he needs, such as a guitar.
 
He is grateful for the opportunity offered by this resource, and is also committed to complying with his payment plan.

loans.use: to purchase several instruments he needs, such as a guitar.

loans.name: Carmen Luz

texts.es:
Carmen nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo de la provincia de Paucartambo. (Paucartambo se encuentra a 2 horas de la ciudad del Cusco). Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad de Calca, está casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Clorinda Matto de Turner” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

Carmen se dedica a la venta de comestibles y tiene un puesto de venta alquilado en uno de los mercados de la ciudad del Calca.
