As a married mother of 5 children, Julieta works hard to support her family. She has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Julieta is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Julieta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a fruit selling business for 9 years in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy assorted fruits to sell. 

Marieta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy assorted fruits to sell

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en: Veneranda, 31 years old, is the mother of one child. She sells different items in her store. Veneranda wants to use this loan to add more new items such as sugar, beans, and rice to sell. She will use the profits from the business for savings. Veneranda is very thankful for the previous loan which she believes helped her so much.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt and beans to sell.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past 6 years, she has operated a fish vending business in the Philippines. Marilou has  requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy assorted fish to sell. In the future, Marilou would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy assorted fish to sell

loans.name: Barno

texts.ru: Барно жительница города Турсунзаде. Ей 44 года. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Она предоставляет услугу такси по городу. В этой области Барно шесть лет. Она берет кредит для приобретения новой машины.
texts.en: Barno is a resident of Tursun-zoda. She is 44 years old, married and has four children. Barno works as a taxi driver in the city. She has worked in this area for six years. Barno is taking out this loan to purchase a new car.

loans.use: to purchase a new car

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор проживает в городе Худжанд. Ей 36 лет. Она разведена. У нее двое детей. Она шесть лет как занимается торговлей детской и женской одежды у себя дома. Кредит берет для приобретения детской вечерней одежды.
texts.en: Gulbahor lives in Khujand. She is 36 years old, divorced and has two children. She has been selling children's and women's clothes from her home for six years. Gulbahor is taking out this loan to purchase party clothes for children.

loans.use: to purchase children clothing

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina has given birth to four sons. Except her youngest son, all of them are enrolled in local school and getting their educations.

She is a seamstress and sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She has great sewing skills and receives a good number of orders every month. Her husband works at a service station.

Sakina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother, who also operates a service station business. With the loan investment, Sakina's brother will buy a water pump, brushes, and cleaning materials that will allow him to offer better services to his clients and increase his profits. He has been operating his business for the past many years and Sakina is confident that his business will improve further after investing the loan.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book, called Asasah Passbook, is Sakina.

loans.use: To buy a water pump and cleaning material for her brother's service station business.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El socio Carlos nació en la ciudad de Pilcopata distrito de Kosñipata de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco pero vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, él tiene 37 años de edad es casado y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene dos hijos. 

El socio Carlos es técnico dental y tiene un pequeño laboratorio dental donde hace piezas dentales y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo yeso, acrílicos, alambres y otras cosas más. 

El socio Carlos agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Carlos was born in the city of Pilcopata in Kosñipata District in Paucartambo Province, Cusco Department but lives in the beautiful city of Cusco.  He’s 37-years-old, married and this beautiful relationship has produced two children.

Carlos is a dental technician; he has a small dental lab where he makes dental products.  On this occasion he needs the loan to buy work materials like plaster, acrylics, wire and other things.

Carlos is grateful for the loan and commits to make his installment payments according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es:
Rosalba tiene 44 años de edad, se describe como una persona responsable y muy trabajadora por el bienestar de su familia. Rosalba vive con su esposo y su hijo en la ciudad de Tulcán que se encuentra en la Provincia del Carchi.

Rosalba trabaja sola en la compra venta de verduras y frutas, negocio que le permite sustentar los gastos de su hogar. Actualmente solicita un préstamo a Fodemi con el fin de invertir en estanterías para sus frutas y verduras que le ayudarán a que su negocio sea mas presentable y también va a invertir en la compra de naranjas, mandarinas y verduras que en esta época la venta sube considerablemente y sus ingresos mejorarían logrando cambiar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Rosalba sueña en tener un local grande para poder ofrecer mayor diversidad de frutas y verduras y otros víveres.
texts.en:
Rosalba, 44, describes herself as a responsible, very hardworking person for her family’s wellbeing.  Rosalba lives with her husband and son in the city of Tulcán located in Carchi Province.

Rosalba works alone buying and selling vegetables and fruit, a business that allows her to cover household expenses.  She is currently asking Fodemi for a loan to invest in shelving for the fruit and vegetables that will help her business be more presentable and she will also invest in the purchase of oranges, mandarins and vegetables which in this season go up considerably and her income improves thus attaining a change in her family’s quality of life.

Rosalba dreams with having a large locale to be able to offer a greater diversity of fruit and vegetables and other foodstuffs.

loans.use: to buy fruit and shelving.

loans.name: Shirinkan

texts.ru:
Ширинкан 53 года, замужем, имеет 2 детей. Ширинкан с 1996 года занимается торговлей продуктами питания, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Ширинкан -  на сегодняшний  день в ее товарообороте имеется примерно 70,000 сом (KGS), доходы от бизнеса помогли Ширинкан купить подержанную машину, на которой сейчас ее муж занимается частным извозом. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Ширинкан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 115,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп товара продуктов питания для перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Ширинкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение и закуп стройматериалов на реконструкцию дома.
texts.en: Shirinkan is 53 years old, married and has two children. Since 1996 Shirinkan has been selling groceries and she started her business with a small sum of 5,000 som (KGS). Due to her hard work and perseverance the grocery store is now worth 70,000 som (KGS) and profits from the business have helped Shirinkan to purchase a used car. Her husband now uses the car as a taxi cab which brings additional profits to the family. In order to further expand their business Shirinkan has turned to "Bai-Tushum and partners" for a loan of 115,000 som (KGS) which she will use to purchase groceries for resale at her store. Shirinkan is planning to use profits from this venture for financing repairs on her house.

loans.use: to purchase goods for reselling

loans.name: Alma

texts.es:
La señora Alma tiene 48 años de edad, es divorciada, tiene 2 hijos, vive en la Ciudad de Villarrica, comenta que vende productos diversos, como artículos electrónicos, ropas etc.
Trabaja en esto hace mas de 20 años, vende en su casa, actualmente tiene una amplia clientela por la facilidad que ofrece al cobrar de forma semanal o quincenal y por tener variados clientes.
Alma tiene como meta poder ampliar su negocio y de esa forma seguir ofreciendo a su familia lo que necesita, solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de todo tipo, como ser remeras, camisas, jeans.
texts.en:
Sra. Alma is 48 years old, divorced and has two children.  She lives in the city of Villarrica and says that she sells different products, such as electronics, clothing, etc. She has been working at this business for more than 20 years and sells from her home. Currently she has a broad customer base because of the easy payment options she offers. By collecting weekly or biweekly, she has attracted many customers. 

Alma’s goal is to expand her business and continue providing her family what it needs. She is requesting a loan to purchase apparel of all kinds, such as T-shirts, shirts and jeans.

loans.use: to purchase T-shirts, shirts and jeans.

loans.name: Isabel De Jesus

texts.es:
Isabel es de la comarca la joya-Teustepe, casado tiene 3 hijas mujeres de 12, 8 y 4 años de edad. Isabel dice que de sus tres hijas solo una estudia  el preescolar ya que la hija mayor aprobó su primaria pero no estudia por el costo de movilizarse hasta la ciudad de Teustepe. Isabel es agricultor se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol desde hace 12 años. Hoy en día con mucho esfuerzo y duro trabajo tiene sus animales, vacas que ha ido comprando con la ganancia de la cosecha ,Isabel en todas las labores agrícolas paga mano de obra, dice también que su cosecha de frijol y maíz la saca a vender a otra comarca al orilla de la carretera  dice que si pudiera venderla aquí mismo en la comarca lo haría  sería bueno para evitar costo. Hoy Isabel necesita este crédito para comprar los insumos, una bomba para fumigar y pagar la mano de obra para la siembra de frijol y maíz.  
Isabel dice que este crédito le será de ayuda ya que podrá retener el maíz que tiene y esperar mejor precio para venderlo también porque con el crédito podrá realizar todo el trabajo que tiene planeado en la siembra del maíz y frijol  él dice que una vez que saque la cosecha pagara el crédito y la ganancia que le  quede comprara unas terneras o unos cerdos para  engorde.
texts.en:
Isabel is from the La Joya-Teustepe district.  He’s married and has three daughters who are 12, 8 and 4 years old.  Isabel says that of his daughters only one attends preschool since the oldest completed primary school but does not now attend school because of the cost involved in getting to the city of Teustepe.

Isabel is a farmer, he’s been growing corn and beans for 12 years.  Today, with much effort and hard work he has his animals, cows that he’s been buying with profits from his harvests.  Isabel pays labor costs for all the farming chores.  He also relates that he sells his bean and corn harvests in another district along the highway but would sell it here if he could to avoid the cost.  Today, Isabel needs this loan to buy supplies, a pump to fumigate and to pay labor costs for the corn and bean planting.

Isabel says that this loan will be of help to him because he will be able to store the corn he has and wait to sell it for a better price.  With the loan he will also be able to do all the work he has planned for the corn and bean planting.  He says that once he reaps his harvest he will repay the loan and with any profits left over will buy some calves and pigs to raise.

loans.use: to buy supplies, a fumigating pump and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: El Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “El Amanecer” está conformado por 18 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de comida rápida, feriantes, venta de ropa nueva, venta de artículos de plásticos, venta de sopaipillas, abarrotes, servicios entre otros. Todos pertenecientes a la comuna La Pintana, ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Lorena, presidenta del grupo del  Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie, ubicándose al fondo de izquierda a derecha ocupando el tercer lugar, viste polera de color negra, y encima usa un pañuelo alrededor de su cuello de color café claro, su cabello es largo de color café oscuro y lo usa suelto.
Ella se dedica al rubro en venta de ropa y venta de bebidas gaseosas, desde hace 1 año. Comenta que trabaja en su casa y algunas veces es ella quien se dirige a los domicilios de sus clientes para ofrecer su mercadería en ropa, y su horario de trabajo lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
Comenta que sus insumos los compra en diferentes supermercados y distribuidoras a bajo costo, por tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará insumos como bebidas y ropa nueva para abastecer su negocio.
Sus metas son continuar con el negocio y tener la posibilidad de abrir un negocio establecido en su casa y generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Lorena vive junto a su esposo y 4 hijas, una de 22 años de edad quien se encuentra trabajando y de 16, 12 y 8 quienes se encuentran estudiando. Sus sueños son tener buenos ingresos en su negocio y una buena salud para ver que sus hijas terminen de estudiar para ver su tarea cumplida.
Lorena está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito y servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza. Además comenta que se siente muy cómoda con las  reuniones y grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que existe generosidad y unidad. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
La Pintana es una comuna ubicada al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile), en la región Metropolitana. Se caracteriza por ser una comuna con altos índices de pobreza, donde más de un 10 por ciento de los habitantes vive en situación de indigencia. Por lo anterior, la autoridad local (municipalidad) se ha preocupado de desarrollar variados programas sociales enfocados a aportar al  mejoramiento de la calidad de vida de sus habitantes.
texts.en:
The name of this communal bank is “El Amanecer” and it is made up of 18 entrepreneurs who make a living in different fields of work such as: selling fast food, selling in street markets, selling new clothing, selling plastic items, selling fried pastries, selling groceries, and other types of services. They all are from the town of La Pintana which is located in the city of Santiago.

In the picture Lorena, the group president of the communal bank, is standing in the back row third from the left. She is wearing a black shirt with a light brown scarf around her neck. She has long, dark brown hair and is wearing it down.

For the past year she has made a living selling clothing and soft drinks. She works from her home and sometimes she is the one that goes to her customers’ homes to sell her clothing and her work schedule depends on their availability.

She buys her supplies from different stores and distributors at a low cost because it is much more financially prudent.

With the loan she will buy supplies such as soft drinks and new clothing to stock her business.

Her goals are to continue to run her business and hopefully be able to open a permanent business in her home to generate higher profits. That way she can have a better quality of life.

Lorena lives with her husband and four children. Her 22-year-old daughter is currently working while the 16-,12-, and 8-year-old are in school. Her dreams are to have a good income from her business and good health so she can see her kids finish school and know that her work is done.

Lorena is very happy and grateful for the loans and services she has received through Fondo Esperanza. She also feels very comfortable at the meetings for the communal bank because there is a lot of generosity and unity in the group. She has learned how to better manage her business through the trainings given in the meetings.

La Pintana is a town that is located to the south of Chile’s capital, Santiago, in the metropolitan area. It is known for being a town with high levels of poverty. More than 10% of the inhabitants live in a state of poverty. For the future, the local authority (the municipality) has looked into developing various social programs focused on contributing to bettering the inhabitants’ quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as soft drinks and new clothing to stock her business.

loans.name: Jipar

texts.ru:
Жыпар 60 лет, вдова, имеет 2 детей. Жыпар с 1972 года начала свою трудовую деятельность ткачихой на фабрике и в качестве дополнительного заработка с  1975 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Жыпар -  на сегодняшний  день  ее хозяйство приносит около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц с продажи молока и молочных продуктов.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жыпар обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота - молодняка.  Доходы от кредита Жыпар планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение своего хозяйства.
texts.en: Jipar is 60 years old, widowed and has two children. Jipar has worked as a weaver at a fabric factory since 1972. She has also been supplementing her salary by raising cattle, a business she started in 1975 with 10,000 som (KGS). Due to Jipar's hard work and perseverance her cattle business now yields 15,000 monthly profits from the sale of milk and dairy products. In order to expand her business further Jipar has turned to "Bai-Tushum and partners" for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) which she will use to purchase calves. She is planning to use the profits from this loan to further expand her herd.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Loma Linda Group

texts.es:
Las nuevas integrantes del grupo Loma Linda son la señora Lucía quien va a usar su préstamo para comprar abono para su cultivo de aguacate; la señora Marcela Yadira, va a comprar tortillas, sabritas (papas fritas), pan y refrescos; la señora Elizabeth va a comprar zapatos, tenis y zapatillas. Las demás integrantes continúan con la actividad que estaban realizando. 

El señor Benigno tiene 36 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos, un varón y una niña (los dos están estudiando la primaria). Benigno vende zapatos y ropa ofreciendo sus productos de casa en casa con los clientes de su comunidad. Solicitó su préstamo para comprar zapatos para dama, caballero y niños: tenis, botas, huaraches y sandalias; también compró ropa interior para dama y caballero. Para Benigno, su negocio es importante porque gracias a él obtiene el ingreso necesario que utiliza para la alimentación de sus hijos, para los gastos de la escuela y para el pago del préstamo. A él le gusta atender a sus clientes con amabilidad y respeto. Benigno también tiene huertas de aguacate; en sus tiempos libres va al campo a ver cómo van los  cultivos. Sus sueños y esperanzas son independizarse y hacer una vida aparte con su familia, ampliar su negocio, poner un local en su domicilio para vender y que sus hijos estudien y tengan una profesión. 

Los integrantes del grupo le dan las gracias a Kiva y a Vision Fund por hacer posible los créditos y esperan seguir recibiendo este apoyo para crecer los negocios y con sus familias.
texts.en: The nine members of the group Loma Linda include Lucía, who will use the loan to buy fertilizer for her avocado trees; Marcel Yadira, who will buy tortillas, sabritas (fried potatoes), bread and sodas; and Elizabeth, who will buy tennis shoes and slippers. The remaining members of the group are continuing with their previous activities. Benigno is 36 years old, is married and has two children (one boy and one girl, both of whom are in elementary school.) He sells shoes and clothes door-to-door in his community. He is seeking this loan in order to buy shoes for men, women and children, including tennis shoes, boots and sandals. He will also buy men's and women's underwear. For Benigno, his business is important because it has enabled him to obtain the income necessary to feed his children, to pay for their education, and to pay back his loans. He likes to offer his customers friendly service and respect. He also has avocado trees; in his free time he goes to check on his crops. His hopes and dreams are to be able to raise his family independently, to grow his business, to open a location in his home from which he can sell his products, and that his children will be continue to study and grow up to have professional jobs. The members of the group give thanks to Kiva and to the Vision Fund for making these loans possible and hope to continue receiving this support in order to grow their businesses and help their families.

loans.use: to buy shoes for men, women and children, including tennis shoes, boots and sandals.

loans.name: Luz Eugenia Gregoria

texts.es: Luz es una mujer casada de 35 años que se dedica a la comercialización de productos por catálogos como bisutería, cosméticos, cuidado personal y perfumería.  Quiere aprovechar la clientela que posee en la empresa privada donde trabaja hace 7 años, vendiendo los productos con mejores plazos y tener disponibilidad de capital para las compras, es por esto que solicita su primer crédito con la entidad y así poder financiar sus pedidos; actualmente le ofrece a sus clientes hasta 30 días de plazo para el pago de la mercancía y obtiene una rentabilidad sobre las ventas del 21%.  Vive en el barrio San José de Barranquilla con su esposo con quien se casó hace 14 años y de cuya unión tienen un hijo de 13 años.  Una vez culminaron sus estudios de bachillerato, Luz realizó los universitarios en Administración y Finanzas, siendo hoy día una muy buena profesional y empleada.  Su capital inicial lo adquirió hace un año y medio con ahorros de lo que devenga como salario, Luz siempre quiso tener un ingreso adicional para solventar algunos otros gastos familiares y personales y ayudar aún más a su esposo, desde entonces desarrolla esta actividad.  Para Luz su mayor desafío es alternar sus actividades profesionales y comerciales con su rol de madre ya que su hijo es discapacitado y  requiere gran parte de su tiempo, sin embargo, ha sido una mujer muy emprendedora, luchadora que ha desempeñado muy bien sus tareas y que a pesar de todas sus ocupaciones, sueña con tener otro hijo para brindarle también todo su amor.  Sueña además con su estabilidad económica, crecimiento personal y viajar por varias partes del mundo.
texts.en:
Luz, 35, is a married woman who sells products like costume jewelry, cosmetics, personal care products and perfumery via catalogue.  She wants to avail herself of the clientele she has in the private firm she’s been working in for the last 7 years selling products with better payment plans and to have capital available for her purchases.  This is why she’s asking for her first loan from the entity in order to finance her orders.  She currently offers up to 30-day payment plans and earns 21% profit margin on merchandise sales.  

She lives in Barranquilla’s San José neighborhood with her husband who she married 14 years ago; their union has produced a son who is 13-years-old.  Once she completed her high-school education, Luz studied business administration and finance at the university which makes her  very professional and employed today.

She got her initial capital a year and a half ago through savings from her salary.  Luz always wanted to have additional income to cover other family and personal expenses and to help her husband even more; she’s been in this business ever since.

For Luz, her greatest challenge is alternating her professional and commercial activities with her role as mother since her son is disabled and requires much of her time.  Nevertheless, she’s been a very enterprising, tenacious woman who has carried out her tasks very well who despite all her occupations dreams with having another child to shower her love on too.  She also dreams with economic stability, personal growth and world travel.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Meriam requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell. She has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Meriam would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Anna

texts.ru:
Анна с семьей живет в селе Великая Знаменка на юго-востоке Украины. У нее есть земельный участок 0, 20 гектара. Она вместе с мужем  занимается выращиванием ранних  томатов.  Имеет успех в этом бизнесе, активно развивается, на участке построили 3 больших теплицы. Товар в этом регионе очень актуален, пользуется спросом.  Этим бизнесом занимается   уже 10 лет. 

Анна просит предоставить ей кредит в размере 10,000 гривен, который она планирует вложить в приобретение семян, удобрений для второго урожая. Прибыль Анна постоянно  вкладывает в  развитие бизнеса. Она имеет опыт в выращивании овощей, поэтому знает что все нужно подготовить заранее. Качественные семена и удобрения помогут Анне  вырастить хороший урожай.
texts.en:
Anna lives with her family in the village of Velikaya Znamenka in south eastern Ukraine. She owns a 0.2 hectar/0.5 acre plot of land where she and her husband grow early tomatoes for sale. Anna is successful in her business and she now has 3 large green houses. Her crops are in high demand in the region and are easy to sell. She has been growing greenhouse vegetables for ten years now. 

Anna is requesting a loan of 10,000 griven which she is planning to use for purchasing seeds and fertilizer for a second harvest. She is planning to use the profits for further expanding her business. Anna has experience in growing vegetables and knows what needs to be ready in advance for planting. The quality seeds and fertilizer she is planning on purchasing will allow Anna to grow a bumper crop of tomatoes.

loans.use: приобрести семена и удобрения для второго урожая

loans.name: Galvez

texts.es:
Gálvez tiene 35 años, es soltero y vive solo en una casita rústica que construyó para cuidar sus terrenos.
Se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 10 años en los terrenos que sus padres le heredaron, por eso construyó su casa cerca de sus cultivos para atenderlos y vigilarlos. Cuenta con dos parcelas de café, los que acaba de cosechar este mes. También produce plátanos y kión, menciona que invierte más dinero en el pago de personal, porque solo no puede abastecerse para atender todos sus cultivos. A la vez se dedica al estudio, ya que hace poco se matriculó en una carrera técnica, por lo que piensa trabajar en el campo, pero sin descuidar sus estudios.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por eso se siente contento de la oportunidad que le dan. Pertenece al banco comunal “Stonkiri de San Pablo” donde sus socios son responsables.
Con el dinero de este préstamo podrá sembrar kión, y pagará a los jornaleros quienes limpiarán las tierras y podarán el cafetal.
texts.en:
Gálvez is 35, single, and lives alone in a small rustic house that he built in order to take care of his land.  For ten years he has made a living through agriculture with the land that his parents left him. For this reason he built his house near his fields so that he could tend to them and watch over them.  

He has two plots of coffee plants which he will be done harvesting this month.  He also produces bananas and ginger.  He says that he invests more money in paying workers because alone he cannot supply enough to tend to his crops.  At the same time, he is dedicated to studying because he recently enrolled himself in a technical degree program.  So he plans to work in the field without neglecting his studies.  

This is his first loan with MFP, and he feels happy with the opportunity it has given him.  He belongs to the communal bank "Stonkiri de San Pablo" whose members are responsible.  With the money from this loan he will be able to plant ginger and to pay the laborers who will clean the land and prune the coffee plants.

loans.use: to pay the laborers that will work in his crops.

loans.name: Jhonny Alberto

texts.es: Jhonny es un joven que vive en el barrio El Valle de la ciudad de Barranquilla, dedicado a la elaboración de artículos estructurales con diferentes metales como el aluminio, hierro, zinc que combinados con vidrio o acrílico son utilizados en oficinas, hogares e industrias. Aprendió de este arte en el lugar donde prestó su servicio militar, cuando retornó a la vida civil deseaba tener una alternativa de generación de ingresos con la que pudiera vivir y fue así como decidió montar su negocio con un corto capital. Solicita su primer credikiva con la entidad con el fin de comprar los diferentes metales utilizados en la producción y algunas herramientas para perfeccionar sus acabados y poder ofrecer un producto a la medida de su clientela. Jhonny actualmente tiene muchos clientes que lo contratan para elaborar los artículos y uno de los mayores desafíos desde que inició su negocio ha sido conseguir el capital para la materia prima y para financiar grandes proyectos y pedidos que le hacen. Con su crédito quiere empezar a fortalecerse para hacer crecer su negocio y convertirlo en una gran empresa con la que pueda satisfacer toda la demanda y con la que obtenga mayores ganancias que le permitan además terminar sus estudios universitarios. Jhonny tiene muchas ganas de seguir adelante y cree que aún le queda tiempo para cumplir sus sueños, es por esto que ya ha empezado a trabajar arduamente por ellos.
texts.en:
Jhonny’s a young man living in Barranquilla’s El Valle neighborhood.  He builds structural items out of various metals like aluminum, iron and zinc which combined with glass or acrylic are used in offices, homes and industries.  He learned this art in the place where he did his military service.  When he returned to civilian life he wanted to have an income generating alternative in order to live and this is how he decided to set up his business with a little capital.

He’s asking for his first Kiva loan with the entity in order to buy different kinds of metal used in production as well as some tools to perfect his finishing touches to offer products to order to his customers.

Jhonny currently has many customers who hire him to make the items and one of his greatest challenges since he started the business has been getting capital for the raw materials and to finance the large projects and orders he gets.

He wants to use the loan to strengthen himself to make his business grow turning it into a great firm with which he can meet all the demand and with which he can earn greater profits that will allow him to finish his university studies.  Jhonny very much wants to continue forward and believes that he still has time to reach his dreams and this is why he’s started to work hard towards them.

loans.use: to buy metal and tools.

loans.name: Elena

texts.ru:
Елена живет  с семьей в   городе Каменка-Днепровская, который находится в  Запорожской области на юго-востоке Украины. Елена арендует магазин, где торгует продуктами питания: рыба, колбасы, макаронные  и  кондитерские изделия, напитки, мороженное, пр. Ей очень нравится заниматься этим бизнесом. В магазине очень аккуратно выставляет товар, всегда чисто и уютно. Другие продуктовые магазины расположены далеко, поэтому у Елены всегда есть покупатели. Товар пользуется спросом, есть постоянные клиенты. В этом бизнесе она работает уже 3 года. 

Елена планирует вложить кредит в 10 000 гривен, полученный от КИВА в закупку товара: хочет закупить больше колбас, кондитерских изделий  и прочее. Елена очень целеустремленный человек и ее бизнес хорошо развивался, но весной этого года произошли две кражи в ее магазине и из оборота была изъята большая сумма денег. Сейчас преступники уже арестованы и скоро понесут наказание. Елена мужественно перенесла эти неприятности и сейчас с еще большим рвением трудится, потому что этот бизнес основной источник дохода для ее семьи.
texts.en:
Elena lives with her family in Kamenka-Dneprovskaya city, which is located in the Zaporozhskaya region of south-eastern Ukraine. Elena rents a store space where she sells groceries: fish, sausages, pasta, pastries, drinks, ice cream etc. She really likes her job. In her store all the groceries are carefully arranged and it is always clean and cozy. Other grocery stores in the city are located far away from Elena's store so there is not shortage of customers. Her groceries are in demand and there are many regular clients. Elena has had her grocery store for 3 years already.

Elena is planning to invest 10000 griven from the Kiva loan to replenish her inventory and purchase more sausage varieties, more kinds of pastries etc. She is a very goal oriented person and her business has been profitable but this spring the store suffered two robberies and Elena lost a lot of money. The criminals have been caught and will be persecuted soon. Elena has bravely survived these disasters and is now working extra hard to repair the damages, as the grocery store is the main source of income for the family.

loans.use: to replenish inventory

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru: Светлана берет очередной кредит, чтобы  открыть новое торговое место на центральном рынке. За счет увеличения оборота, Светлана планирует получить дополнительную прибыль. Прошлой зимой Светлане пришлось нелегко. Был заметный спад торговли из-за ухудшеня погоды. Тем не менее, Светлана мужественно справилась с таким негараздом и к середине весны вышла на прежний уровень доходов. Она серьезно настроена развивать свой бизнес дальше, т.к. он является единственным источником дохода.
texts.en: Svetlana is taking out another loan so that she can finance the opening of a second market stall at the central market. She is hoping to get substantial profits from the increased goods turn-over. Last winter Svetlana had difficulties as the bad weather resulted in diminished purchasing. Despite this set back Svetlana has been able to return to high profit levels come spring. She is very serious about expanding her business as it is the sole source of income for her.

loans.use: to open a new market stall

loans.name: Bayaraa

texts.en:
Mr. Bayaraa, 35, is an electrician in the power plant in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. His salary is not so high and it does not usually meet his family's needs. He lives with his wife and his two children in their old house. His wife is a pharmacist, but she still has not been employed and she runs a taxi business to increase the family's income. 

His house was built in the early 1990s and since then it has never been renovated or had any repairs. Due to this, it is becoming difficult and uncomfortable to live in their old, bad house. Especially in winter, his house becomes very cold due to the heat loss through the windows and walls. So he decided to make necessary repairs to his house. To start with, he is planning to put in wall and window insulation. He hopes it will be very helpful to reduce the smoky coal usage and the related excessive fuel cost. 

Although Mongolia has the lowest population density in the world, it is one of the most polluted countries in the world. This is due to the long and cold winters where temperatures frequently go below -40 ºC (-40 ºF), even in the cities.  Also, in summer, many parts of the country are extremely cold and are known to have snow storms. Both homes and nomadic tents burn a lot of fuel and emit huge amounts of pollution every night from families just trying to stay warm. In response to this, Credit Mongol offers Green Loans to their clients to make home improvements that reduce heat loss and improve heating systems. Credit Mongol believes that together, we can decrease pollution and the harmful effects it has on the environment and Mongolians' health. The loan Mr. Bayaraa is taking will be dedicated to buying building materials to make the repairs and to insulate the walls of his old apartment rooms to reduce heat loss and emissions.

loans.use: To buy building materials to make repairs and to insulate the walls of his old apartment rooms to reduce heat loss and emissions.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 52 years old and married with six children. With one child in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Narcisa runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Narcisa has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, spices, eggs, soft drinks, etc.. In the future Narcisa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 36 years old and married with four children who are in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Perla runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Perla has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, milk, canned goods, etc. In the future Perla would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Umida

texts.ru: Умида проживает в городе Худжанд. Ей 27 лет. Она замужем. У нее один ребенок. Умида у себя дома занимается шитьем, она в основном шьет матрасы на заказ. В этой области она два года. Кредит берет для приобретения материалов.
texts.en: Umida lives in Khujand. She is 27 years old, married and has one child. Umida is a seamstress and sews Tajik mattresses and blankets from home. She has been in this business for two years. Umida is taking out this loan to purchase fabric.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Bisalomat

texts.ru: Бисаломат- женщина в возрасте  57 лет, она имеет троих детей.К великому несчастью ее муж скончался несколько лет назад. Она сама работает в больнице, старшей медсестрой.У нее очень плохие условия проживания.Всю прошедшую зиму у нее протекала крыша и они очень тяжело провели зиму.Ее заработная плата уходит только на семейные расходы.Теперь на полученный кредит она хочет отремонтировать крышу в своем доме и освежить комнаты.  Она получает очередной третий кредит, и за период кредитования ни разу не нарушала условия организации.Благодарит за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Bisalomat is a 57 year old woman and has three children. Unfortunately her husband passed away several years ado. Bisalamot works as a nurse at the local hospital. Her house is in bad shape and the roof has been leaking all winter. Bisalamot's salary is just enough to support her family and not enough to pay for roof repairs. She is planning to use this loan to repair the roof and refresh the rest of the house. This is her third loan and Bisalamot has never defaulted and always repaid on time. She is very grateful for your financial support.

loans.use: for home repairs

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for many years. He is 40 years old and married to his wife Ann, and they have three school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds, pesticides, and fertilizer for use in his farm.

In future, Elijah hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds, pesticides, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Gina Paola

texts.es: Hace más de tres años Gina, una joven de 24 años, residente en el barrio Barlovento de Barranquilla, decide junto con su esposo montar una pequeña panadería en su casa, donde ofrece panes, pudines, deditos, pastelitos y demás productos de la pastelería francesa.  Todo empezó para Gina cuando al ver que su esposo se encontraba sin empleo, que conocía del oficio y que su familia tenía mucha experiencia en ello, le planteó que iniciaran la actividad en su casa.  No contaban con el dinero para la maquinaria pero una vecina suya, quien había tenido panadería y aún tenía los equipos, le ofreció arrendárselos con opción de compra, ella aceptó y hasta el día de hoy los utilizan.  Compra a diario lo que necesita para la producción y su cartera rota cada dos días, tiempo en el que cobra lo vendido. Solicita su primer credikiva porque requiere invertir en insumos y materia prima como harina, margarina, levaduras, esencias, huevos para la producción, con ello podría tener un stock de inventario y atendería la creciente demanda, además desea adquirir una vitrina exhibidora para vender directamente al público, ya que actualmente elabora el producto e inmediatamente lo distribuye entre las tiendas del barrio, su principal clientela. El mayor reto para ella representa el poder tener sus propios equipos de panadería y no tener que arrendarlos más a su vecina, así obtendría una mayor ganancia y una rentabilidad a la actual que es del 28%.  Gina vive con su esposo y tres hijos menores de edad, producto de su unión.  Además de la panadería, obtiene ingresos mensuales por la venta de mercancía por encargo para lo cual le concede a sus clientes hasta 30 días de plazo para el pago.
texts.en:
More than three years ago, Gina, 24, a young woman living in Barranquilla’s Barlovento neighborhood, decided to set up a small, home-based bakery with her husband where she offers bread, pudding, cookies, cakes and other French pastries.  

Everything began for Gina when her husband became unemployed.  He knew the business very well since his family had much experience in it.  She suggested they start the business at home.  They did not have any money for the machinery but a neighbor of hers who had owned a bakery and still had the equipment offered to rent it to them with an option to buy.  She accepted and they still use it to date.

She buys what she needs for production daily and her portfolio rotates every two days, the time in which she collects payment for what she sells.  She’s asking for her first Kiva loan because she wants to reinvest in supplies and raw materials like flour, margarine, yeast, spices and eggs for production.  With this she will be able to have stock on hand to meet growing demand.  In addition, she wants to buy a display case to sell directly to the public since she currently makes the product and immediately distributes it to neighborhood stores, her main clientele.

Her greatest challenge is being able to own her own baking equipment and not have to rent it from her neighbor any longer so that her profits will be greater and her profitability will be higher than her current 28%.

Gina lives with her husband and three minor children, the products of her union.  In addition to the bakery, she earns additional monthly income selling merchandise to order for which she gives her customers up to 30-day payment plans.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and a display case.

loans.name: Husniddin

texts.ru: Хусниддин живет в кишлаке более 10 лет и занимается выращиванием сельхозпродуктов, так как в кишлаке развито сельское хозяйство. Хусниддин выращивает картофель и пшеницу. Он также одновременно занимается откормом и продажей скота. Хусниддин женат и воспитывает четверых детей.  Его заботливая жена и дети помогают в ведении бизнеса. Хусниддин хотел бы получить займ для покупки минеральных удобрений, чтобы повысить уровень урожайности. Он надеется на вашу помощь и поддержку и заранее благодарен вам.
texts.en: Husniddin lived in his village for more then 10 years and has been farming for just as long. His village is famous for their produce. Husniddin grows potatoes and wheat as well as raises cattle for sale. He is married and has four children. His caring wife and kids help at the farm. Husniddin wants to take out this loan to purchase fertilizer so that he can increase his crop yield. He hopes for your help and support and is very grateful to everyone.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Tserenkhand

texts.en:
Mrs. Tserenkhand, 49, works in the customs of Mongolia. Actually she is a doctor and pharmacist. She lives with her husband and daughter and her old mother in the common apartment which is in Kherlen, an eastern boundary city in Mongolia.

She wants to take a loan to buy building materials for the repairs of her old apartment. She is planning to insulate the walls and windows at first because it becomes very cold inside the rooms without the wall insulation, then it costs too much money for the smoky coal to warm the rooms inside. Also it contributes to the bad air in the city. 

Although Mongolia has the lowest population density in the world, it is one of the most polluted countries in the world.  This is due to the long and cold winters, where temperatures frequently go below -40C (-40F) even in the cities. Also, in summer, many parts of the country are extremely cold and are known to have snow storms. Both homes and nomadic tents burn a lot of fuel and emit huge amounts of pollution every night from families just trying to stay warm. In response to this, Credit Mongol offers Green Loans to their clients to make home improvements that reduce heat loss and improve heating systems. We believe that together we can decrease pollution and the harmful effects it has on the environment and Mongolians' health.

The loan Tserenkhand is taking will be dedicated to buying the building materials to make repairs and to insulate the walls of her old apartment rooms to reduce heat loss and emissions.

loans.use: To buy building materials to make repairs and to insulate the walls of her old apartment rooms to reduce heat loss and emissions.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia forma parte del Banco Comunal “Semillitas del Sur” perteneciente a la ciudad de Talca.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio, específicamente almacén, desde hace 2 años. Comenta que trabaja sola de lunes a sábado de 9ºº hasta 21ºº, su almacén lo tiene establecido en su casa.
Su mercadería e insumos que va necesitando para reponer en su almacén la compra en diferentes supermercados y distribuidoras a bajo costo, por tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará una maquina congeladora, y un poco mas de mercadería para abastecer su almacén.
Una de sus metas es tener un almacén más grande con gran variedad de productos e insumos para su clientela, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Patricia vive junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijas de 19 y 10 años de edad quienes se encuentran estudiando. Sus sueños son tener su casa propia para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
Ella está muy agradecida y contenta de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades, intereses, lo cual también le ha servido como un momento de distracción.
Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
Patricia is part of the “Semillitas Del Sur” (Little Seeds from the South) communal bank belonging to the city of Talca.  She’s been a merchant, specifically a grocer, for the last two years.  She comments that she works by herself Monday through Saturday from 9am until 9pm; her store is home-based.  She buys the merchandise and supplies she needs to restock her store in various economically convenient supermarkets and low-price distributorships.

She will use the loan to buy a freezer and a little more merchandise to stock her store.  One of her goals is to have a larger store with a greater variety of products and ingredients for her clientele to generate higher income and thus be able to opt for a better quality of life.

Patricia lives with her husband and two daughters who are 19 and 10 years old and who are students.  Her dream is to own her house to provide her family with a better quality of life.

She is very grateful and happy for the opportunity Fondo Esperanza has given her because it’s allowed her to invest in her business.  In addition, she feels very comfortable in the company of her fellow entrepreneurs in the communal bank because they share different activities and interests which have been moments of enjoyment for her.  With respect to the training provided at meetings, she’s learned how to better run her business.

Talca belongs to the Maule Region located in the center of the country.  It’s the administrative, cultural and economic center of the region being the most important city in the Chilean Central Valley.

There is a curious reference to Talca in Chile, the phrase “Talca, París y Londres” (Talca, Paris and London).  Among the myths referring to it, some say it comes originally from something an Englishman said:  “Talca parece Londres” (Talca seems like London) because of the thick fog that frequently blankets the city in winter similar to the capital of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and more stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Peang

texts.en:
Peang is a local farmer who works hard at a rice field in order to support her family's living. She is 52 years old, is married, and has six children – three single children and three married children. She permanently lives with her family in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. Crop husbandry is the main income source of the family, allowing her to provide basic necessities and further education to her children. Her husband helps her manage the business besides his main business of producing mortars and pestles from raw mountain stones.

Due to the shortage of capital to pay for planting corn, Peang is now applying for a loan in the sum of 500 USD to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and pesticide, and to pay for labor costs. This loan will be a sufficient capital for her to continually develop her farming business and make it more profitable. She believes that she will be able to help her children attend colleges when they finish their studies at the high school level.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and pesticide, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Enkhtuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Enkhtuya is a cook and she runs a cafeteria in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been running her business since 2009 and she has gained enough experience in her business. Her cafeteria is located near the bus station and she has had a lot of permanent customers in the past 3 years.

Enkhtuya lives with her son and old mother in the ger (yurt) district, an area of city with no running water, minimal roads, and spotty electricity. During the summer, her business becomes very busy and she has many customers due to celebrations or vacations. Every summer she needs to increase her working capital for items such as groceries. Also she plans to replace some of the equipment in her cafeteria kitchen. Therefore she is requesting a loan to cover the cost of purchasing kitchen tools and groceries to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To cover the cost of purchasing kitchen tools and groceries to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Ceramie

texts.en: 22 year old Ceramie lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with her 5 year old child. She runs a sari-sari business to support herself and her child. She sells items like snack foods, canned goods and toiletries to her community. She works hard to increase her sales and buy their basic needs. She has requested this loan to buy canned goods, coffee, snack foods and more items to sell. This loan will help increase Ceramie's sales and profitability.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, coffee, snack foods and more items to sell.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
This is Jose. He is 58 years old and a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, in the Philippines. His wife is Gloria, an OFW (overseas Filipino worker) and mother to their two children. Jose, together with his children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jose operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five Philippine pesos worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Jose earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 350 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operating his business, he is requesting a loan of 11,000 PHP. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Jose hopes to be able to expand soon. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week. At these meetings, he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in his business.

loans.name: Leisys Maria

texts.es: Leisys es una mujer de 34 años que reside con sus tres hijos en el barrio Los Almendros del municipio de Soledad.  Posee un negocio con productos variados que ofrecer como cervezas por cajas para llevar, elabora y vende fritos como patacones, deditos, papas, empanadas, entre otros, vende productos naturales, carnes frías y ropa en general.  El credikiva solicitado lo empleará en la compra de surtido para su  negocio como carnes frías tipo salchichón, butifarras y queso, ropa como pantalones, camisueters y productos naturales como vitamina E, colágeno y omega para con ello satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes que poco a poco ha ido aumentando, ya que uno de sus principales retos ha sido no poder responder algunas veces a los pedidos que le hacen. Sus clientes cancelan quincenalmente y compra y distribuye su mercancía cada 7 días. Para la venta de cerveza cuenta con un enfriador de su propiedad donde almacena el producto.  A pesar de que Leisys es una mujer separada, ha levantado a sus menores brindándoles la educación y los valores necesarios para que sean personas de bien en el mañana, es una mujer con una mentalidad muy amplia y con mucha visión de negocio ya que tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar algunos años en la universidad, ella desea que su microempresa crezca cada vez más para obtener mayores ingresos y poder brindarle un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Leisys is a 34 year old woman who resides with her three children in Los Almendros neighborhood in the town of Soledad. She has a business selling many different products, such as beer to go by the case. She makes and sells fried food such as plantains, deditos (a finger food made of puff pastry and stuffed with cheese, etc.), potatoes and empanadas, among others. She also sells natural products, cold cuts and clothing in general.

She will use the Kiva loan she is requesting to purchase supplies for her business, such as cold cuts like salami, sausages and cheese, clothing like pants, shirts and sweaters and natural products like Vitamin E, collagen, and the omegas. With these products she will satisfy her customers’ demands, which have been gradually growing, since one of her principal challenges has been not being able at times to respond to her clients’ requests. Her clients pay her every two weeks and she buys and resells her merchandise every seven days. For her beer sales, she has a freezer she owns where she stores the product. 

Despite the fact that she is separated Leisys has raised her youngsters with the education and values necessary for them to became good people tomorrow. She is a very board-minded woman and a far-sighted business person since she had the opportunity to study a few years at the university. She wants her small business to grow more and more so that she can earn more income and provide a better future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase cold cuts, clothing and natural products to re-sell.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
El socio Jorge Luis nació en la ciudad de Arequipa pero vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, él tiene 25 años de edad  y es soltero.  

El socio Jorge Luis  se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y tiene varios galpones donde viven sus animales. En esta oportunidad Jorge Luis requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de los galpones va comprar calaminas, madera, clavos y otras cosas más. 

El socio Jorge Luis agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis was born in the city of Arequipa but now lives in the beautiful city of Cusco. He is 25 years old and single.

He raises small animals such as guinea pigs and has several sheds where his animals live. At this time, Jorge Luis needs a loan to do upkeep on his sheds. He is going to purchase corrugated iron, wood, nails and other items.

He is grateful for the loan and is committed to making all of his payments on time.

loans.use: to do upkeep on his sheds by purchasing corrugated iron, wood, nails and other items.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 36 years old. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lilibeth has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos through NWTF to buy materials for her fishing boat.

Lilibeth has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy materials for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Anna is 31 years old and her two children are in school.

Anna has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 19,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production.

Anna has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to expand her local eatery business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production.

loans.name: Vi

texts.en: Mrs. Vi is 50 years old. Her four children are all adults. She is a carpenter with an income of 4,200,000 VND a month. She has participated in crediting programs with SEDA since 2009. The last cycle, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this cycle, she wants to borrow 8,736,000 VND to enlarge her carpentry studio at home.

loans.use: to enlarge her carpentry studio at home.

loans.name: Queenie

texts.en:
Queenie is 25 years old and married with two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Queenie has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her business.

Queenie has been in this business for one year. In the future, Queenie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Salvacion requested a loan of 16,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy fish and ingredients for making dried fish. She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Salvacion would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her grandchildren to school.

loans.use: to buy fish and ingredients for making dried fish.

loans.name: Sandra Cecilia

texts.es: Sandra es una mujer soltera de 32 años que comercializa gran variedad de mercancía como ropa, cosméticos, calzado, entre otros, además de hielo y minutos a celular.  Desde muy joven le tocó ayudar en su casa puesto que lo que ganaba su madre trabajando como empleada del servicio doméstico no era suficiente para los gastos familiares.  A través de una amiga, empezó a vender productos por encargo que compraban por catálogos especializados.  Hoy en día Sandra compra directamente los productos y los vende entre sus clientes del barrio La Sierrita donde vive, amigos y referidos. Con su primer credikiva pretende comprar un mayor surtido de productos para la venta, con lo cual cumpliría a los pedidos realizados. Dentro de esos productos se encuentran perfumes, lencería, ropa, electrodomésticos menores.  Con ello espera que sus ventas se incrementen y así mismo su rentabilidad a más de un 40%, nivel que maneja actualmente.  Sus clientes compran principalmente a crédito y le pagan con plazos no mayores a 30 días.  Su principal desafío es mantener su negocio en el sector donde reside, ya que se presentan algunos problemas de inseguridad que la obligan a ser muy cuidadosa y estricta con sus clientes.  Por eso su mayor sueño es poder algún día tener los recursos necesarios para comprar una vivienda en otro sector de la ciudad.
texts.en: Sandra, 32, is a single woman who sells a large variety of merchandise such as clothing, cosmetics, shoes, etc, as well as ice and cell phone minutes.  Since she was very young, she had to help in her home because what her mother earned from her work as a maid, wasn’t enough to cover the household expenses.  Through a friend she began to sell products by order that were bought through specialized catalogs.  Nowadays Sandra buys the products directly and sells them to customers in the La Sierrita neighborhood where she lives-to friends and referred customers.  With her first Kiva loan she bought a large quantity of products to fill the existing orders.  These products are items such as perfumes, lingerie, clothing, and small electrical appliances.  With it she hopes that her sales will increase for a profit of more than 40%, the level that she currently manages.  Her customers buy mostly on credit and pay her under 30 days.  Her main problem is  keeping her business in the area where she lives because there are security issues that force her to be very careful and strict with her customers.  Her big dream is to some day have the resources necessary to buy a house in another part of the city.

loans.use: to buy new products such as lingerie, small electrical appliances, and clothing to fill the orders from her customers

loans.name: Noela

texts.en:
Noela is married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Noela is 32 years old and has two children who are in school.

Noela has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Noela has requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy more fish and ingredients for her dried-fish making.

Noela has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Noela would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy more fish and ingredients for her dried-fish making

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Jenelyn is 37 years old and has two children who are in school.

Jenelyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. Jenelyn has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets, bamboo, nylon threads and paint for her fishing boat.

Jenelyn has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Jenelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets, bamboo, nylon threads, and paint for her fishing boat

loans.name: Sifore

texts.en:
Sifore is 39 years old. She is married to a businessman and they both have six children aged between 4 and 22, who all go to school. 

Sifore sells sorghum and has been in the business for thirteen years. With the loan, she wants to buy more sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a widow with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Virginia has a fruit business in the Philippines, for which she buys and sells fruit.  Virginia has requested a PHP 29500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fruits to sell.

Virginia has been in this business for 10 years.  In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fruits to sell.

loans.name: Thuong

texts.en: Mrs. Thuong is 37 years old. She has three children who are going to school. She has been working as a carpenter for eight years and earns an income of 4,300,000 VND each month. She has been participating in SEDA's credit program since 2010. The last cycle, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid that loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,288,000 VND to expand her carpentry studio at home.

loans.use: To expand her carpentry studio at home

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda works hard to support her family. Rosalinda is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Rosalinda requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat and to make repairs.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 11 years.

In the future, Rosalinda would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: To buy a new engine for her fishing boat and to make repairs

loans.name: Gloria Estefany

texts.es: Gloria se encuentra muy satisfecha con la inversión que realizó con su primer credikiva, ya que compró varios artículos para vender a sus clientes que le solicitaban en el momento, con esto pudo complacer sus gustos y aumentar el ingreso familiar.  Nuevamente solicita crédito con el fin de seguir comprando más artículos artesanales elaborados en madera como jarrones, mesas, floreros, lámparas, mecedores, rinconeras, entre otros de gran variedad.  Gloria es una joven muy inquieta y con ganas de superarse para hacer de su negocio una gran empresa.  Desde que le otorgaron su primer crédito, Gloria inició un curso de Contabilidad y Finanzas en una institución pública de programas profesionales donde ha recibido 5 módulos, esto la tiene muy contenta y cada día trabaja para hacer su sueño una realidad, quiere organizar bien el negocio dentro de su casa dándole mayor espacio para que sea visto por las personas que transitan por allí.  Su mensaje para los fondeadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Gracias a ustedes he alcanzado mis metas y mantengo el firme propósito de seguir adelante para lograr todos y cada uno de mis objetivos, muchas gracias por su apoyo.”
texts.en: Gloria is very satisfied with the investment that she made with her first Kiva loan, because she bought a number of items to sell that her customers were demanding at the time.  With this investment she was able to satisfy their preferences and increase her family income.  She is requesting a loan again so that she can continue to buy more handcrafted items made from wood such as vases, tables, lamps, rocking chairs, sectional benches, and a variety of other items.  Gloria is a restless youth with a strong desire to excel and build her business into a large company.  Ever since she was granted her first loan, Gloria has been enrolled in accounting and finance classes in a public institution that offers professional programs; she has completed 5 modules there.  This makes her very happy, and she works every day to make her dream a reality.  She wants to organize her business inside her house, giving it more space so that it can be seen by passers-by.  Her message for all the Kiva lenders is the following: "Thanks to all of you, I am striving toward my goals, and maintaining a firm intention to continue ahead so that I can achieve each and every one of my goals.  Thank you so much for your support."

loans.use: to buy handcrafted items made from wood such as: vases, tables, lamps, rocking chairs, sectional benches, and a variety of other items

loans.name: Ochirkhuu

texts.en:
Mr. Ochirkhuu is 43 years old and lives with his family in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. He is an electrician in a private company, where he has been working since 2007.  Before that Mr. Ochirkhuu used to run a taxi business. 

Mr. Ochirkhuu's monthly salary does not usually cover his family's necessities. So he wants to restart his old business - the taxi business - again. He will run it beyond his work in the nighttime. So, he now needs money to cover the cost of purchasing a car. It will be a car with a natural gas engine which is natural-oriented and less harmful to the environment. 

Although Mongolia has the lowest population density in the world, it is one of the most polluted countries in the world. This is due to the long and cold winters where temperatures frequently go below -40C (-40F) even in the cities.  Also, in summer, many parts of the country are extremely cold and are known to have snowstorms.  Both homes and nomadic tents burn a lot of fuel and emit huge amounts of pollution every night from families just trying to stay warm.  As well, the smoky and extremely toxic smoke from the cars is one of main reasons for Mongolia's hard air pollution.

In response to this, Credit Mongol offers Green Loans to their clients to make home improvements that reduce heat loss, improve heating systems and buy cars that run on natural gas.  We believe that together we can decrease pollution and the harmful effects it has on the environment and Mongolians' health. The loan he is taking will used to cover the cost of buying a car which uses natural gas.

loans.use: To cover the cost of buying a car which uses natural gas.

loans.name: Shameem's Group

texts.en:
Shameem is 58 years old and works as a nurse.

She has a 17-year-old son who is in the 10th grade.

Her husband operates a sweet meat selling business at the market.  The taste of his sweet meat is very good, and he has a good number of clients who purchase sweet meat from him on a regular basis.

Shameem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to further expand her husband’s business.

With the loan investment, he will buy ingredients such as sugar, cooking oil, etc. to be able to make a larger quantity of sweet meat and increase his profits.

He has been operating his business for many years, and Shameem is hopeful that the loan will help him earn more profits from his business.

Note: In the photo, the lady is holding a book that is called "Asasah Passbook is Shameem."

loans.use: To buy cooking oils and sugar to make sweet meat to sell

loans.name: Enkhtaivan

texts.en:
Mrs. Enkhtaivan, 55, is a pensioner who lives with her husband and her son in a ger district, an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads, and spotty electricity. 

Her husband works as a watchman in a company, and he doesn't earn that much. Enkhtaivan’s retirement benefit is about $125 per month, and both of their incomes do not cover their family’s expenses. Her son works in a supermarket. 

Recently, her husband decided to start a taxi business to increase their family's income. So, Enkhtaivan is taking out a loan to support her husband and the start-up of his new business. As he said, he will run a taxi after his day job (during the night), and that will be very helpful in solving his family's financial issues. 

The main thing is that he is choosing a car that runs on natural gas. He and Enkhtaivan totally believe it will help to reduce the air pollution from cars. Although Mongolia has the lowest population density in the world, it is one of the most polluted countries in the world.  This is due to the long and cold winters where temperatures frequently go below -40C, even in the cities.  

Also, in the summer, many parts of the country are extremely cold and are known to have snow storms. Both homes and nomadic tents burn a lot of fuel and emit huge amounts of pollution every night from families just trying to stay warm.  In addition, the extremely toxic smoke from cars is another reason for Mongolia's air pollution. 

In response to this, Credit Mongol offers Green Loans to their clients to make home improvements that reduce heat loss, improve heating systems, and also to buy cars that use natural gas.  We believe that together we can decrease the pollution and the harmful effects it has on the environment and Mongolians' health. 

The loan Mrs. Enkhtaivan is taking out will be used to cover the cost of buying a car that uses natural gas.

loans.use: To cover the cost of buying a car that uses natural gas

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 41 years old. She is married to a businessman. Alphonsine sells goats and has been in this business for 10 years. She wants the loan for buying more goats to sell. With the profits from her business, she will increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy more goats to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Marilou is 42 years old and has four children who are in school.

Marilou has a variety store in the Philippines. Marilou requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like toys, plastic ware, earrings, etc. to sell in her store.

She has been in this business for 12 years. Marilou would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: To buy more items like toys, plastic ware, earrings, etc. to sell in her store

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 40 years old and married with 4 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Arlene is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Arlene has been raising pigs for 12 years.   She also earns additional income from motorcycle transport and farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business preparing and selling food in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Merlinda has been in this business for a year. She also earns income from raising pigs.

Merlinda has sustained her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for her food-vending business

loans.name: Alita

texts.en:
Alita is 48 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, Alita works very hard to provide for them.

Alita runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.  She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items, such as spices, sugar, soap, shampoo, etc. 

In the future Alita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Anadelia

texts.en:
Anadelia is 36 years old and married with six children. With three children in school, Anadelia works very hard to provide for them.

Anadelia runs a school supplies business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more school supplies to sell.

Anadelia has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items, such as papers, notebook, crayons, ball point pens, etc. 

In the future Anadelia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine, age 24, sells rice and cooking oil. She wants this loan to buy more rice and cooking oil to increase her inventory. With the profits from her business, she plans to make savings.

loans.use: to buy more rice and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en: Mrs. Loan is 28 years old. She has two little children. She is a carpenter. Her income is about 4,200,000 dong (VND) per month. She has taken part in the crediting program of SEDA since 2009. The last cycle, she borrowed 8,288,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,184,000 VND to upgrade her carpentry studio at home.

loans.use: to upgrade her carpentry studio at home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more wood – the basic material for his furniture business

loans.name: Claudio Edgar

texts.es:
El socio Claudio pertenece al banco comunal “Siempre Juntos” y las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en el distrito de Huanchac de la provincia de Cusco y del departamento de Cusco. El socio Claudio se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, él sigue teniendo un galpón que es un espacio especial para criar cuyes, el socio ha aprendido todo sobre la crianza, alimentación, reproducción, gestación de estos animales. El socio Claudio requiere el préstamo para comprar más animales menores como cuyes y para la alimentación. 

El socio Claudio agradece la oportunidad del préstamo que le permitirá invertir en el negocio y crecer económicamente.
texts.en:
Claudio is a member of the Communal Bank "Siempre Juntos" (Always Together), a group that conducts its meetings every 30 days in the District of Huanchac in Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

Claudio raises small animals, such as guinea pigs, and still has a pen with a special area for raising the guinea pigs. He learned everything related to the care, diet, reproduction, and gestation of these animals. Claudio is requesting a loan in order to buy more animals, such as guinea pigs, and the appropriate feed.

He appreciates the opportunity to access a loan so that he can invest in his business and grow financially.

loans.use: to buy more guinea pigs and the appropriate feed.

loans.name: Tham
